Trying Bing... ‚ùå Error with Google Scholar search: 429 Client Error: Too Many Requests for url: https://serpapi.com/search.json?q=%22Critical+Asian+Studies%22+Afghanistan+Soviet+1979+defensive+archival+declassified&api_key=44e78c148756b2caaece7c2556ca93278d0ccc51d26a5274fb5af3cdbdbdcbe9&engine=google_scholar&num=20 === CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES SEARCH COMPLETED === Objective: Locate specific article analyzing Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion Status: Direct journal access attempted, alternative academic search conducted if needed Next steps: Review saved search results and access identified articles for bibliographic details
tester
2025-08-07 02:36:27
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered two major access barriers that prevented completion of the **PLAN** objectives. First, the direct Taylor & Francis journal access returned a 403 Forbidden error, indicating the publisher blocks automated requests. Second, the fallback Google Scholar search via SerpAPI failed with a 429 Too Many Requests error, suggesting API rate limits were exceeded. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no article was located and no bibliographic details were extracted. The code structure and search logic appear sound, but both primary and alternative access methods are currently blocked. Recommended next steps: (1) Implement request delays and session management to avoid rate limiting, (2) Try alternative academic databases like JSTOR or Project MUSE APIs, (3) Use institutional library proxy access if available, or (4) Contact the journal editorial office directly as suggested in the **PLAN**. Consider saving any successful partial results to workspace/ files for future reference.
Python Code python
import requests import json import os from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time from urllib.parse import urljoin, urlparse print('=== ACCESSING CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES JOURNAL FOR SOVIET AFGHANISTAN INVASION ANALYSIS ===') print('Objective: Locate article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials arguing defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion\n') # Step 1: Access the Critical Asian Studies journal main page journal_url = 'https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20' print(f'Accessing Critical Asian Studies journal: {journal_url}') # Set up headers to mimic browser request headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } try: print('Making request to Taylor & Francis Critical Asian Studies journal...') response = requests.get(journal_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) response.raise_for_status() print(f'‚úì Successfully accessed journal page (Status: {response.status_code})') print(f'Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Parse the journal homepage soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract journal information journal_title = soup.find('h1') or soup.find('title') if journal_title: print(f'Journal title: {journal_title.get_text().strip()}') # Look for volume/issue archive links print('\n=== SEARCHING FOR JOURNAL ARCHIVES AND VOLUME LINKS ===') archive_links = [] volume_links = [] # Common patterns for archive/volume links archive_patterns = ['archive', 'volumes', 'issues', 'back-issues', 'all-issues'] all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f'Found {len(all_links)} total links on journal homepage') for link in all_links: href = link.get('href') text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Look for archive-related links if any(pattern in href.lower() or pattern in text for pattern in archive_patterns): full_url = urljoin(journal_url, href) archive_links.append({ 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'url': full_url, 'type': 'archive' }) # Look for volume-specific links (e.g., "Volume 50", "Vol. 49") if ('volume' in text or 'vol.' in text) and any(char.isdigit() for char in text): full_url = urljoin(journal_url, href) volume_links.append({ 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'url': full_url, 'type': 'volume' }) print(f'\nFound {len(archive_links)} archive-related links:') for i, link in enumerate(archive_links[:5], 1): print(f'{i}. {link["text"]} -> {link["url"]}') print(f'\nFound {len(volume_links)} volume-specific links:') for i, link in enumerate(volume_links[:5], 1): print(f'{i}. {link["text"]} -> {link["url"]}') # Step 2: Try to access the journal archive page if archive_links: primary_archive_url = archive_links[0]['url'] print(f'\n=== ACCESSING PRIMARY ARCHIVE: {primary_archive_url} ===') try: archive_response = requests.get(primary_archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) archive_response.raise_for_status() print(f'‚úì Successfully accessed archive page (Status: {archive_response.status_code})') archive_soup = BeautifulSoup(archive_response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for volume/year listings in archive print('\n=== ANALYZING ARCHIVE STRUCTURE ===') # Find all links that might represent volumes or years archive_volume_links = [] for link in archive_soup.find_all('a', href=True): text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') # Look for year patterns (2010-2023 focus) if any(year in text for year in ['2010', '2011', '2012', '2013', '2014', '2015', '2016', '2017', '2018', '2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023']): full_url = urljoin(primary_archive_url, href) archive_volume_links.append({ 'text': text, 'url': full_url, 'year': next((year for year in ['2010', '2011', '2012', '2013', '2014', '2015', '2016', '2017', '2018', '2019', '2020', '2021', '2022', '2023'] if year in text), 'unknown') }) # Also look for volume numbers that might correspond to recent years elif 'volume' in text.lower() and any(char.isdigit() for char in text): volume_num = ''.join(filter(str.isdigit, text)) if volume_num and int(volume_num) >= 40: # Assuming recent volumes are 40+ full_url = urljoin(primary_archive_url, href) archive_volume_links.append({ 'text': text, 'url': full_url, 'volume': volume_num }) print(f'Found {len(archive_volume_links)} relevant volume/year links in archive:') for i, link in enumerate(archive_volume_links[:10], 1): print(f'{i}. {link["text"]} -> {link["url"]}') # Step 3: Search specific volumes for Afghanistan-related articles print('\n=== SEARCHING FOR AFGHANISTAN-RELATED ARTICLES ===') afghanistan_articles = [] search_keywords = [ 'afghanistan', 'soviet', 'invasion', '1979', 'defensive', 'archival', 'declassified', 'ussr', 'cold war', 'intervention' ] # Search through the most promising volume links (limit to avoid too many requests) for i, volume_link in enumerate(archive_volume_links[:8]): print(f'\nSearching volume {i+1}: {volume_link["text"]}') try: volume_response = requests.get(volume_link['url'], headers=headers, timeout=20) volume_response.raise_for_status() volume_soup = BeautifulSoup(volume_response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for article titles and abstracts article_elements = volume_soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'div', 'p'], class_=lambda x: x and ('title' in x.lower() or 'article' in x.lower() or 'abstract' in x.lower())) for element in article_elements: text = element.get_text().strip().lower() # Check if this element contains Afghanistan-related keywords if any(keyword in text for keyword in search_keywords): # Found potential match article_info = { 'volume_text': volume_link['text'], 'volume_url': volume_link['url'], 'element_text': element.get_text().strip(), 'element_type': element.name, 'matching_keywords': [kw for kw in search_keywords if kw in text] } # Try to find associated article link article_link = element.find('a', href=True) if not article_link: article_link = element.find_parent().find('a', href=True) if element.find_parent() else None if article_link: article_info['article_url'] = urljoin(volume_link['url'], article_link.get('href')) afghanistan_articles.append(article_info) print(f' ‚úì POTENTIAL MATCH: {element.get_text().strip()[:100]}...') print(f' Keywords found: {article_info["matching_keywords"]}') time.sleep(1) # Be respectful to the server except Exception as e: print(f' ‚ùå Error accessing volume {volume_link["text"]}: {str(e)}') continue print(f'\n=== AFGHANISTAN ARTICLE SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Found {len(afghanistan_articles)} potential matches:') for i, article in enumerate(afghanistan_articles, 1): print(f'\nMatch {i}:') print(f'Volume: {article["volume_text"]}') print(f'Text: {article["element_text"][:200]}...') print(f'Keywords: {article["matching_keywords"]}') if 'article_url' in article: print(f'Article URL: {article["article_url"]}') print('-' * 80) # Save search results search_results = { 'journal_url': journal_url, 'archive_url': primary_archive_url, 'search_objective': 'Find article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials arguing defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'search_keywords': search_keywords, 'volumes_searched': len(archive_volume_links[:8]), 'potential_matches': afghanistan_articles, 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } results_file = 'workspace/critical_asian_studies_afghanistan_search.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Search results saved to: {results_file}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error accessing archive page: {str(e)}') else: print('\n‚ö† No archive links found on journal homepage') print('Attempting alternative search approach...') # Alternative: Search the main page content for any Afghanistan references main_content = soup.get_text().lower() if any(keyword in main_content for keyword in ['afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979']): print('‚úì Found Afghanistan-related content on main page') else: print('No Afghanistan content found on main page') except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f'‚ùå Error accessing Critical Asian Studies journal: {str(e)}') print('This might be due to access restrictions or network issues') # Alternative approach: Use academic search engines print('\n=== ATTEMPTING ALTERNATIVE SEARCH APPROACH ===') print('Using Google Scholar search for Critical Asian Studies + Afghanistan + Soviet') # Check if we have SerpAPI key for academic search api_key = os.getenv('SERPAPI_API_KEY') if api_key: print('SerpAPI key available - conducting academic search') scholar_query = '"Critical Asian Studies" Afghanistan Soviet 1979 defensive archival declassified' params = { 'q': scholar_query, 'api_key': api_key, 'engine': 'google_scholar', 'num': 20 } try: scholar_response = requests.get('https://serpapi.com/search.json', params=params) scholar_response.raise_for_status() scholar_results = scholar_response.json() if 'organic_results' in scholar_results: print(f'\n‚úì Found {len(scholar_results["organic_results"])} Google Scholar results') critical_asian_matches = [] for result in scholar_results['organic_results']: title = result.get('title', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') publication_info = result.get('publication_info', {}).get('summary', '') # Check if this is from Critical Asian Studies if 'critical asian studies' in (title + snippet + publication_info).lower(): critical_asian_matches.append({ 'title': title, 'snippet': snippet, 'publication_info': publication_info, 'link': result.get('link', ''), 'cited_by': result.get('inline_links', {}).get('cited_by', {}).get('total', 0) }) print(f'\nüéØ CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES MATCH:') print(f'Title: {title}') print(f'Publication: {publication_info}') print(f'Snippet: {snippet[:200]}...') print(f'Link: {result.get("link", "")}') print(f'Cited by: {result.get("inline_links", {}).get("cited_by", {}).get("total", 0)} articles') print('-' * 80) if critical_asian_matches: # Save the Google Scholar results scholar_results_data = { 'search_query': scholar_query, 'total_results': len(scholar_results['organic_results']), 'critical_asian_studies_matches': critical_asian_matches, 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') } scholar_file = 'workspace/google_scholar_critical_asian_studies_results.json' with open(scholar_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(scholar_results_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Google Scholar results saved to: {scholar_file}') print(f'Found {len(critical_asian_matches)} Critical Asian Studies articles about Afghanistan/Soviet topics') else: print('\n‚ö† No Critical Asian Studies articles found in Google Scholar results') else: print('\n‚ùå No organic results in Google Scholar response') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error with Google Scholar search: {str(e)}') else: print('No SerpAPI key available for academic search') print('Consider accessing the journal through institutional library resources') print('\n=== CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES SEARCH COMPLETED ===') print('Objective: Locate specific article analyzing Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Status: Direct journal access attempted, alternative academic search conducted if needed') print('Next steps: Review saved search results and access identified articles for bibliographic details')
Execution Output
Code Output: === ACCESSING CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES JOURNAL FOR SOVIET AFGHANISTAN INVASION ANALYSIS === Objective: Locate article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials arguing defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion Accessing Critical Asian Studies journal: https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20 Making request to Taylor & Francis Critical Asian Studies journal... ‚ùå Error accessing Critical Asian Studies journal: 403 Client Error: Forbidden for url: https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20 This might be due to access restrictions or network issues === ATTEMPTING ALTERNATIVE SEARCH APPROACH === Using Google Scholar search for Critical Asian Studies + Afghanistan + Soviet SerpAPI key available - conducting academic search - Searx error: name 'BeautifulSoup' is not defined... Trying Bing... ‚ùå Error with Google Scholar search: 429 Client Error: Too Many Requests for url: https://serpapi.com/search.json?q=%22Critical+Asian+Studies%22+Afghanistan+Soviet+1979+defensive+archival+declassified&api_key=44e78c148756b2caaece7c2556ca93278d0ccc51d26a5274fb5af3cdbdbdcbe9&engine=google_scholar&num=20 === CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES SEARCH COMPLETED === Objective: Locate specific article analyzing Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion Status: Direct journal access attempted, alternative academic search conducted if needed Next steps: Review saved search results and access identified articles for bibliographic details
developer
2025-08-07 02:38:56
Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import time import requests from urllib.parse import quote_plus import json print('=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: ACADEMIC DATABASE SEARCH FOR CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES AFGHANISTAN ARTICLE ===') print('Objective: Locate article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials arguing defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion') print('Strategy: Use multiple search approaches with proper rate limiting and error handling\n') # Check workspace for any existing search results first workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Existing workspace files: {workspace_files}') else: os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory') # Strategy 1: Try a more general academic search with rate limiting print('\n=== STRATEGY 1: GENERAL ACADEMIC SEARCH WITH RATE LIMITING ===') api_key = os.getenv('SERPAPI_API_KEY') if api_key: print(f'SerpAPI key available: {api_key[:10]}...') # Use a more targeted but broader search query search_queries = [ 'Critical Asian Studies Afghanistan Soviet defensive invasion 1979', '"Critical Asian Studies" Soviet Afghanistan archival materials', 'Afghanistan Soviet invasion defensive motives declassified archives', 'Critical Asian Studies journal Soviet Union Afghanistan 1979' ] all_search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/4: {query}') # Add delay between requests to avoid rate limiting if i > 1: print('Waiting 5 seconds to avoid rate limiting...') time.sleep(5) params = { 'q': query, 'api_key': api_key, 'engine': 'google', # Use regular Google instead of Scholar to avoid 429 errors 'num': 15, 'safe': 'off' } try: print('Making request to SerpAPI...') response = requests.get('https://serpapi.com/search.json', params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() print(f'‚úì Search successful (Status: {response.status_code})') if 'organic_results' in results: print(f'Found {len(results["organic_results"])} organic results') # Filter for academic/journal results academic_results = [] for result in results['organic_results']: title = result.get('title', '').lower() snippet = result.get('snippet', '').lower() link = result.get('link', '').lower() # Check for academic indicators academic_indicators = [ 'critical asian studies', 'tandfonline', 'taylor francis', 'jstor', 'project muse', 'academia.edu', 'researchgate', '.edu', 'journal', 'academic', 'university' ] # Check for Afghanistan/Soviet content content_indicators = [ 'afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979', 'invasion', 'ussr', 'defensive', 'archival', 'declassified' ] has_academic = any(indicator in (title + snippet + link) for indicator in academic_indicators) has_content = any(indicator in (title + snippet) for indicator in content_indicators) if has_academic and has_content: academic_results.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'snippet': result.get('snippet', ''), 'link': result.get('link', ''), 'academic_indicators': [ind for ind in academic_indicators if ind in (title + snippet + link)], 'content_indicators': [ind for ind in content_indicators if ind in (title + snippet)] }) print(f' ‚úì ACADEMIC MATCH: {result.get("title", "")[:80]}...') print(f' Link: {result.get("link", "")}') print(f' Academic indicators: {[ind for ind in academic_indicators if ind in (title + snippet + link)]}') print(f' Content indicators: {[ind for ind in content_indicators if ind in (title + snippet)]}') all_search_results.extend(academic_results) print(f'Added {len(academic_results)} academic results from this search') else: print('No organic results found') if 'error' in results: print(f'API Error: {results["error"]}') elif response.status_code == 429: print(f'‚ùå Rate limited (429). Waiting 10 seconds before continuing...') time.sleep(10) continue else: print(f'‚ùå Search failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text[:200]}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') continue print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Total academic matches found: {len(all_search_results)}') if all_search_results: # Remove duplicates based on URL unique_results = [] seen_urls = set() for result in all_search_results: url = result['link'] if url not in seen_urls: unique_results.append(result) seen_urls.add(url) print(f'Unique results after deduplication: {len(unique_results)}') # Sort by relevance (number of content indicators) unique_results.sort(key=lambda x: len(x['content_indicators']), reverse=True) print('\n=== TOP ACADEMIC RESULTS ===') for i, result in enumerate(unique_results[:5], 1): print(f'\nResult {i}:') print(f'Title: {result["title"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print(f'Academic source: {result["academic_indicators"]}') print(f'Content relevance: {result["content_indicators"]}') print(f'Search query: {result["query"]}') print('-' * 100) # Save comprehensive results search_data = { 'search_objective': 'Find Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion', 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'total_unique_results': len(unique_results), 'top_results': unique_results[:10], # Save top 10 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'search_method': 'SerpAPI Google Search with academic filtering' } results_file = 'workspace/academic_search_afghanistan_soviet_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Search results saved to: {results_file}') # Strategy 2: Try to access the most promising results directly print('\n=== STRATEGY 2: DIRECT ACCESS TO TOP RESULTS ===') headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } accessed_content = [] for i, result in enumerate(unique_results[:3], 1): # Try top 3 results print(f'\nAttempting to access result {i}: {result["title"][:50]}...') print(f'URL: {result["link"]}') try: time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay response = requests.get(result['link'], headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f'‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})') print(f'Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Save the content for analysis content_file = f'workspace/accessed_content_{i}.html' with open(content_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: f.write(response.text) accessed_content.append({ 'result_index': i, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['link'], 'content_file': content_file, 'content_length': len(response.content), 'status': 'success' }) # Quick check for key terms in content content_lower = response.text.lower() key_terms_found = [] key_terms = ['critical asian studies', 'afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979', 'defensive', 'archival', 'declassified'] for term in key_terms: if term in content_lower: key_terms_found.append(term) print(f'Key terms found in content: {key_terms_found}') if len(key_terms_found) >= 4: # High relevance threshold print('üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE CONTENT - This may contain the target article!') else: print(f'‚ùå Access failed (Status: {response.status_code})') accessed_content.append({ 'result_index': i, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['link'], 'status': f'failed_{response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error accessing result {i}: {str(e)}') accessed_content.append({ 'result_index': i, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['link'], 'status': f'error_{str(e)[:50]}' }) # Update results with access information search_data['accessed_content'] = accessed_content search_data['successful_accesses'] = len([c for c in accessed_content if c['status'] == 'success']) with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Updated results with access information saved to: {results_file}') print(f'Successfully accessed {len([c for c in accessed_content if c["status"] == "success"])}/3 top results') else: print('‚ùå No academic results found matching the criteria') else: print('‚ùå No SerpAPI key available') # Strategy 3: Manual search guidance print('\n=== STRATEGY 3: MANUAL SEARCH GUIDANCE ===') print('Since automated search is limited, here are manual search recommendations:') manual_search_info = { 'journal_name': 'Critical Asian Studies', 'publisher': 'Taylor & Francis', 'journal_url': 'https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20', 'search_focus': 'Articles published 2010-2023 analyzing Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion', 'key_search_terms': [ 'Afghanistan Soviet invasion 1979', 'Soviet defensive motives Afghanistan', 'declassified Soviet archives Afghanistan', 'USSR Afghanistan intervention defensive' ], 'alternative_databases': [ 'JSTOR (jstor.org)', 'Project MUSE (muse.jhu.edu)', 'Academic Search Complete (EBSCOhost)', 'Humanities International Complete', 'Historical Abstracts' ], 'institutional_access': 'Contact university library for database access', 'direct_contact': 'Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office for article identification assistance' } guidance_file = 'workspace/manual_search_guidance.json' with open(guidance_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_search_info, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Manual search guidance saved to: {guidance_file}') for key, value in manual_search_info.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f'{key.replace("_", " ").title()}: {len(value)} options') for item in value: print(f' - {item}') else: print(f'{key.replace("_", " ").title()}: {value}') print('\n=== SEARCH COMPLETION SUMMARY ===') print('Objective: Locate Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Methods attempted: (1) Rate-limited academic search, (2) Direct content access, (3) Manual guidance') print('Status: Multiple search strategies implemented with comprehensive result documentation') print('Next steps: Review workspace files for identified articles and bibliographic details')

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code was completely blocked by API rate limiting (429 errors) across all 4 search attempts, preventing any data collection. The SerpAPI service appears to have strict rate limits that were exceeded despite the implemented delays and waiting periods. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no article searches were completed and no bibliographic details were obtained. The code structure shows good planning with multiple search strategies, proper error handling, and comprehensive result documentation, but the fundamental access issue prevents execution. The existing workspace files from previous attempts suggest this is an ongoing rate limiting problem. Recommended immediate fix: (1) Wait 24+ hours before retrying to reset API limits, (2) Implement exponential backoff delays between requests, (3) Use alternative search methods like direct institutional database access, or (4) Proceed with manual search using the guidance already saved in workspace/manual_search_guidance.json. The comprehensive search framework is solid but needs alternative data sources.
Python Code python
import os import time import requests from urllib.parse import quote_plus import json print('=== ALTERNATIVE APPROACH: ACADEMIC DATABASE SEARCH FOR CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES AFGHANISTAN ARTICLE ===') print('Objective: Locate article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials arguing defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion') print('Strategy: Use multiple search approaches with proper rate limiting and error handling\n') # Check workspace for any existing search results first workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Existing workspace files: {workspace_files}') else: os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory') # Strategy 1: Try a more general academic search with rate limiting print('\n=== STRATEGY 1: GENERAL ACADEMIC SEARCH WITH RATE LIMITING ===') api_key = os.getenv('SERPAPI_API_KEY') if api_key: print(f'SerpAPI key available: {api_key[:10]}...') # Use a more targeted but broader search query search_queries = [ 'Critical Asian Studies Afghanistan Soviet defensive invasion 1979', '"Critical Asian Studies" Soviet Afghanistan archival materials', 'Afghanistan Soviet invasion defensive motives declassified archives', 'Critical Asian Studies journal Soviet Union Afghanistan 1979' ] all_search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/4: {query}') # Add delay between requests to avoid rate limiting if i > 1: print('Waiting 5 seconds to avoid rate limiting...') time.sleep(5) params = { 'q': query, 'api_key': api_key, 'engine': 'google', # Use regular Google instead of Scholar to avoid 429 errors 'num': 15, 'safe': 'off' } try: print('Making request to SerpAPI...') response = requests.get('https://serpapi.com/search.json', params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() print(f'‚úì Search successful (Status: {response.status_code})') if 'organic_results' in results: print(f'Found {len(results["organic_results"])} organic results') # Filter for academic/journal results academic_results = [] for result in results['organic_results']: title = result.get('title', '').lower() snippet = result.get('snippet', '').lower() link = result.get('link', '').lower() # Check for academic indicators academic_indicators = [ 'critical asian studies', 'tandfonline', 'taylor francis', 'jstor', 'project muse', 'academia.edu', 'researchgate', '.edu', 'journal', 'academic', 'university' ] # Check for Afghanistan/Soviet content content_indicators = [ 'afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979', 'invasion', 'ussr', 'defensive', 'archival', 'declassified' ] has_academic = any(indicator in (title + snippet + link) for indicator in academic_indicators) has_content = any(indicator in (title + snippet) for indicator in content_indicators) if has_academic and has_content: academic_results.append({ 'query': query, 'title': result.get('title', ''), 'snippet': result.get('snippet', ''), 'link': result.get('link', ''), 'academic_indicators': [ind for ind in academic_indicators if ind in (title + snippet + link)], 'content_indicators': [ind for ind in content_indicators if ind in (title + snippet)] }) print(f' ‚úì ACADEMIC MATCH: {result.get("title", "")[:80]}...') print(f' Link: {result.get("link", "")}') print(f' Academic indicators: {[ind for ind in academic_indicators if ind in (title + snippet + link)]}') print(f' Content indicators: {[ind for ind in content_indicators if ind in (title + snippet)]}') all_search_results.extend(academic_results) print(f'Added {len(academic_results)} academic results from this search') else: print('No organic results found') if 'error' in results: print(f'API Error: {results["error"]}') elif response.status_code == 429: print(f'‚ùå Rate limited (429). Waiting 10 seconds before continuing...') time.sleep(10) continue else: print(f'‚ùå Search failed with status {response.status_code}: {response.text[:200]}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') continue print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Total academic matches found: {len(all_search_results)}') if all_search_results: # Remove duplicates based on URL unique_results = [] seen_urls = set() for result in all_search_results: url = result['link'] if url not in seen_urls: unique_results.append(result) seen_urls.add(url) print(f'Unique results after deduplication: {len(unique_results)}') # Sort by relevance (number of content indicators) unique_results.sort(key=lambda x: len(x['content_indicators']), reverse=True) print('\n=== TOP ACADEMIC RESULTS ===') for i, result in enumerate(unique_results[:5], 1): print(f'\nResult {i}:') print(f'Title: {result["title"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print(f'Academic source: {result["academic_indicators"]}') print(f'Content relevance: {result["content_indicators"]}') print(f'Search query: {result["query"]}') print('-' * 100) # Save comprehensive results search_data = { 'search_objective': 'Find Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion', 'search_queries_used': search_queries, 'total_unique_results': len(unique_results), 'top_results': unique_results[:10], # Save top 10 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'search_method': 'SerpAPI Google Search with academic filtering' } results_file = 'workspace/academic_search_afghanistan_soviet_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Search results saved to: {results_file}') # Strategy 2: Try to access the most promising results directly print('\n=== STRATEGY 2: DIRECT ACCESS TO TOP RESULTS ===') headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } accessed_content = [] for i, result in enumerate(unique_results[:3], 1): # Try top 3 results print(f'\nAttempting to access result {i}: {result["title"][:50]}...') print(f'URL: {result["link"]}') try: time.sleep(3) # Respectful delay response = requests.get(result['link'], headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f'‚úì Successfully accessed (Status: {response.status_code})') print(f'Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes') # Save the content for analysis content_file = f'workspace/accessed_content_{i}.html' with open(content_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: f.write(response.text) accessed_content.append({ 'result_index': i, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['link'], 'content_file': content_file, 'content_length': len(response.content), 'status': 'success' }) # Quick check for key terms in content content_lower = response.text.lower() key_terms_found = [] key_terms = ['critical asian studies', 'afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979', 'defensive', 'archival', 'declassified'] for term in key_terms: if term in content_lower: key_terms_found.append(term) print(f'Key terms found in content: {key_terms_found}') if len(key_terms_found) >= 4: # High relevance threshold print('üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE CONTENT - This may contain the target article!') else: print(f'‚ùå Access failed (Status: {response.status_code})') accessed_content.append({ 'result_index': i, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['link'], 'status': f'failed_{response.status_code}' }) except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error accessing result {i}: {str(e)}') accessed_content.append({ 'result_index': i, 'title': result['title'], 'url': result['link'], 'status': f'error_{str(e)[:50]}' }) # Update results with access information search_data['accessed_content'] = accessed_content search_data['successful_accesses'] = len([c for c in accessed_content if c['status'] == 'success']) with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Updated results with access information saved to: {results_file}') print(f'Successfully accessed {len([c for c in accessed_content if c["status"] == "success"])}/3 top results') else: print('‚ùå No academic results found matching the criteria') else: print('‚ùå No SerpAPI key available') # Strategy 3: Manual search guidance print('\n=== STRATEGY 3: MANUAL SEARCH GUIDANCE ===') print('Since automated search is limited, here are manual search recommendations:') manual_search_info = { 'journal_name': 'Critical Asian Studies', 'publisher': 'Taylor & Francis', 'journal_url': 'https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20', 'search_focus': 'Articles published 2010-2023 analyzing Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion', 'key_search_terms': [ 'Afghanistan Soviet invasion 1979', 'Soviet defensive motives Afghanistan', 'declassified Soviet archives Afghanistan', 'USSR Afghanistan intervention defensive' ], 'alternative_databases': [ 'JSTOR (jstor.org)', 'Project MUSE (muse.jhu.edu)', 'Academic Search Complete (EBSCOhost)', 'Humanities International Complete', 'Historical Abstracts' ], 'institutional_access': 'Contact university library for database access', 'direct_contact': 'Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office for article identification assistance' } guidance_file = 'workspace/manual_search_guidance.json' with open(guidance_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_search_info, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Manual search guidance saved to: {guidance_file}') for key, value in manual_search_info.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f'{key.replace("_", " ").title()}: {len(value)} options') for item in value: print(f' - {item}') else: print(f'{key.replace("_", " ").title()}: {value}') print('\n=== SEARCH COMPLETION SUMMARY ===') print('Objective: Locate Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Methods attempted: (1) Rate-limited academic search, (2) Direct content access, (3) Manual guidance') print('Status: Multiple search strategies implemented with comprehensive result documentation') print('Next steps: Review workspace files for identified articles and bibliographic details')
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 3)

Python Code python
import os import json import time from urllib.parse import quote, urljoin import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup print('=== COMPREHENSIVE WORKSPACE ANALYSIS AND ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY ===') print('Objective: Locate Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Strategy: Analyze existing workspace data and implement non-API search methods\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what data we already have workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:') for i, file in enumerate(workspace_files, 1): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'{i}. {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') else: os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory') # Analyze the most relevant existing files print('\n=== ANALYZING EXISTING RESEARCH DATA ===') relevant_files = [ 'final_actionable_research_summary.json', 'cas_article_research_guide.txt', 'cas_article_research_hypotheses.json', 'comprehensive_final_search_summary.json' ] existing_data = {} for filename in relevant_files: filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'\n--- Analyzing {filename} ---') try: if filename.endswith('.json'): with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'JSON structure keys: {list(data.keys()) if isinstance(data, dict) else "Not a dict"}') existing_data[filename] = data # Show key information if isinstance(data, dict): for key, value in list(data.items())[:3]: # Show first 3 key-value pairs if isinstance(value, (str, int, float)): print(f' {key}: {str(value)[:100]}...' if len(str(value)) > 100 else f' {key}: {value}') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}') elif filename.endswith('.txt'): with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f'Text file content (first 300 chars): {content[:300]}...') existing_data[filename] = content except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {filename}: {str(e)}') else: print(f'{filename} not found in workspace') # Strategy: Direct institutional database search using known academic URLs print('\n=== STRATEGY: DIRECT INSTITUTIONAL DATABASE ACCESS ===') print('Attempting to access academic databases directly without API restrictions') # List of academic database URLs that might have Critical Asian Studies content academic_databases = [ { 'name': 'JSTOR', 'search_url': 'https://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Afghanistan Soviet 1979 defensive' }, { 'name': 'Project MUSE', 'search_url': 'https://muse.jhu.edu/search?action=search&query=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Soviet Afghanistan invasion archival' }, { 'name': 'Academia.edu', 'search_url': 'https://www.academia.edu/search?q=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Afghanistan Soviet defensive motives 1979' }, { 'name': 'ResearchGate', 'search_url': 'https://www.researchgate.net/search?q=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Soviet Afghanistan invasion declassified archives' } ] # Set up headers to mimic browser requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', 'Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', 'Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', 'Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none' } database_search_results = [] for i, db in enumerate(academic_databases, 1): print(f'\n--- Searching {db["name"]} ({i}/{len(academic_databases)}) ---') # Construct search URL search_url = db['search_url'] + quote(db['query']) print(f'Search URL: {search_url}') try: # Add delay to be respectful if i > 1: print('Waiting 3 seconds between requests...') time.sleep(3) response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=25) print(f'Response status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: print(f'‚úì Successfully accessed {db["name"]} (Content: {len(response.content):,} bytes)') # Save the raw HTML for analysis html_file = f'workspace/{db["name"].lower().replace(" ", "_")}_search_results.html' with open(html_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved HTML content to: {html_file}') # Parse the HTML to look for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for result titles and links (different patterns for each database) result_elements = [] if 'jstor' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h3', 'h4'], class_=lambda x: x and ('title' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower())) elif 'muse' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3'], class_=lambda x: x and ('title' in x.lower() or 'citation' in x.lower())) elif 'academia' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3'], class_=lambda x: x and 'title' in x.lower()) elif 'researchgate' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h3', 'h4'], class_=lambda x: x and 'title' in x.lower()) # Also try generic approaches if not result_elements: result_elements = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=lambda text: text and any(keyword in text.lower() for keyword in ['afghanistan', 'soviet', 'critical asian'])) print(f'Found {len(result_elements)} potential result elements') # Extract and analyze results db_results = [] for j, element in enumerate(result_elements[:5], 1): # Limit to first 5 results title_text = element.get_text().strip() # Look for associated links link_element = element.find('a', href=True) if not link_element: link_element = element.find_parent().find('a', href=True) if element.find_parent() else None result_url = '' if link_element: href = link_element.get('href') if href.startswith('http'): result_url = href else: # Construct full URL base_url = f"https://{db['search_url'].split('/')[2]}" result_url = urljoin(base_url, href) # Check relevance relevance_keywords = ['critical asian studies', 'afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979', 'defensive', 'invasion', 'archival', 'declassified'] found_keywords = [kw for kw in relevance_keywords if kw in title_text.lower()] if found_keywords: # Only include results with relevant keywords result_data = { 'database': db['name'], 'title': title_text, 'url': result_url, 'relevance_keywords': found_keywords, 'relevance_score': len(found_keywords) } db_results.append(result_data) print(f' Result {j}: {title_text[:80]}...') print(f' Keywords: {found_keywords}') print(f' URL: {result_url}') database_search_results.extend(db_results) # Look for any direct mentions of "Critical Asian Studies" in the page content page_text = soup.get_text().lower() cas_mentions = page_text.count('critical asian studies') afghanistan_mentions = page_text.count('afghanistan') soviet_mentions = page_text.count('soviet') print(f'Page content analysis:') print(f' "Critical Asian Studies" mentions: {cas_mentions}') print(f' "Afghanistan" mentions: {afghanistan_mentions}') print(f' "Soviet" mentions: {soviet_mentions}') if cas_mentions > 0 and afghanistan_mentions > 0: print('üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE: Page contains both Critical Asian Studies and Afghanistan content!') elif response.status_code == 403: print(f'‚ùå Access forbidden to {db["name"]} (403 error)') elif response.status_code == 429: print(f'‚ùå Rate limited by {db["name"]} (429 error)') else: print(f'‚ùå Unexpected status code {response.status_code} from {db["name"]}') except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f'‚ùå Network error accessing {db["name"]}: {str(e)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Unexpected error with {db["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Consolidate and analyze all results print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED DATABASE SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Total results found across all databases: {len(database_search_results)}') if database_search_results: # Sort by relevance score database_search_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\n--- TOP RESULTS BY RELEVANCE ---') for i, result in enumerate(database_search_results[:5], 1): print(f'\nResult {i} (Score: {result["relevance_score"]}):') print(f'Database: {result["database"]}') print(f'Title: {result["title"]}') print(f'URL: {result["url"]}') print(f'Keywords: {result["relevance_keywords"]}') print('-' * 80) # Save consolidated results consolidated_data = { 'search_objective': 'Find Critical Asian Studies article analyzing Soviet defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'search_method': 'Direct academic database access without APIs', 'databases_searched': [db['name'] for db in academic_databases], 'total_results_found': len(database_search_results), 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'top_results': database_search_results[:10], 'search_queries_used': [db['query'] for db in academic_databases] } results_file = 'workspace/direct_database_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(consolidated_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Consolidated results saved to: {results_file}') # Check if any results specifically mention Critical Asian Studies journal cas_specific_results = [r for r in database_search_results if 'critical asian studies' in r['title'].lower()] if cas_specific_results: print(f'\nüéØ FOUND {len(cas_specific_results)} RESULTS SPECIFICALLY MENTIONING CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES:') for result in cas_specific_results: print(f' - {result["title"]}') print(f' Database: {result["database"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('\n‚ö† No results specifically mention "Critical Asian Studies" journal') else: print('‚ùå No relevant results found in any database') # Alternative Strategy: Manual research compilation print('\n=== MANUAL RESEARCH COMPILATION STRATEGY ===') print('Creating comprehensive research guide for manual article identification') manual_research_guide = { 'target_article_characteristics': { 'journal': 'Critical Asian Studies', 'publisher': 'Taylor & Francis', 'publication_period': '2010-2023 (when Soviet archives became declassified)', 'topic': 'Soviet defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'methodology': 'Analysis of declassified Soviet archival materials', 'argument': 'Soviet invasion was defensive rather than aggressive expansion' }, 'search_strategies': { 'direct_journal_contact': { 'method': 'Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office', 'email_template': 'Request assistance locating article analyzing declassified Soviet archives on Afghanistan invasion defensive motives', 'journal_contact': 'https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20' }, 'institutional_library_access': { 'databases_to_check': [ 'Academic Search Complete (EBSCO)', 'Humanities International Complete', 'Historical Abstracts', 'JSTOR (full institutional access)', 'Project MUSE (full access)', 'Taylor & Francis Online (institutional subscription)' ], 'search_terms': [ '"Critical Asian Studies" AND Afghanistan AND Soviet AND defensive', '"Critical Asian Studies" AND 1979 AND invasion AND archival', 'Afghanistan Soviet defensive motives declassified archives' ] }, 'author_identification_approach': { 'method': 'Search for scholars specializing in Soviet-Afghan relations', 'potential_author_fields': [ 'Soviet/Russian history specialists', 'Cold War historians', 'Central Asian studies experts', 'Military history scholars', 'International relations theorists' ] } }, 'verification_criteria': { 'must_have_elements': [ 'Published in Critical Asian Studies journal', 'Uses declassified Soviet archival materials', 'Argues defensive rather than offensive motives', 'Focuses on 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'Published between 2010-2023' ] } } guide_file = 'workspace/comprehensive_manual_research_guide.json' with open(guide_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_research_guide, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Comprehensive manual research guide saved to: {guide_file}') print('\n=== SEARCH COMPLETION SUMMARY ===') print('Objective: Locate Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Methods implemented:') print(' 1. ‚úì Workspace data analysis completed') print(' 2. ‚úì Direct academic database searches conducted (4 databases)') print(' 3. ‚úì HTML content saved for offline analysis') print(' 4. ‚úì Comprehensive manual research guide created') print('\nStatus: Alternative search strategies implemented to bypass API limitations') print('Next steps: Review saved HTML files and follow manual research guide for article identification') print('\nFiles created in workspace:') for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if any(keyword in file for keyword in ['search', 'results', 'guide']): print(f' - {file}')

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Partial success - Code executed without critical errors and implemented a comprehensive alternative search strategy to bypass API limitations. The workspace analysis successfully identified 9 existing research files, and the code attempted direct access to 4 academic databases (JSTOR, Project MUSE, Academia.edu, ResearchGate). However, most database access was blocked (JSTOR and ResearchGate returned 403 errors), and while Project MUSE and Academia.edu were accessible, no specific article results were extracted from the HTML content. **PLAN** alignment: 40% - systematic search approach implemented but target article not located. The code has a minor bug at the end (undefined 'file' variable) but successfully created comprehensive manual research guidance and saved HTML files for offline analysis. Recommendation: Fix the variable error in the final file listing loop, then review the saved HTML files (project_muse_search_results.html, academia.edu_search_results.html) for manual article identification, and follow the detailed manual research guide created in comprehensive_manual_research_guide.json.
Python Code python
import os import json import time from urllib.parse import quote, urljoin import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup print('=== COMPREHENSIVE WORKSPACE ANALYSIS AND ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY ===') print('Objective: Locate Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Strategy: Analyze existing workspace data and implement non-API search methods\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what data we already have workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): workspace_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:') for i, file in enumerate(workspace_files, 1): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'{i}. {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') else: os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory') # Analyze the most relevant existing files print('\n=== ANALYZING EXISTING RESEARCH DATA ===') relevant_files = [ 'final_actionable_research_summary.json', 'cas_article_research_guide.txt', 'cas_article_research_hypotheses.json', 'comprehensive_final_search_summary.json' ] existing_data = {} for filename in relevant_files: filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'\n--- Analyzing {filename} ---') try: if filename.endswith('.json'): with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'JSON structure keys: {list(data.keys()) if isinstance(data, dict) else "Not a dict"}') existing_data[filename] = data # Show key information if isinstance(data, dict): for key, value in list(data.items())[:3]: # Show first 3 key-value pairs if isinstance(value, (str, int, float)): print(f' {key}: {str(value)[:100]}...' if len(str(value)) > 100 else f' {key}: {value}') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}') elif filename.endswith('.txt'): with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: content = f.read() print(f'Text file content (first 300 chars): {content[:300]}...') existing_data[filename] = content except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {filename}: {str(e)}') else: print(f'{filename} not found in workspace') # Strategy: Direct institutional database search using known academic URLs print('\n=== STRATEGY: DIRECT INSTITUTIONAL DATABASE ACCESS ===') print('Attempting to access academic databases directly without API restrictions') # List of academic database URLs that might have Critical Asian Studies content academic_databases = [ { 'name': 'JSTOR', 'search_url': 'https://www.jstor.org/action/doBasicSearch?Query=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Afghanistan Soviet 1979 defensive' }, { 'name': 'Project MUSE', 'search_url': 'https://muse.jhu.edu/search?action=search&query=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Soviet Afghanistan invasion archival' }, { 'name': 'Academia.edu', 'search_url': 'https://www.academia.edu/search?q=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Afghanistan Soviet defensive motives 1979' }, { 'name': 'ResearchGate', 'search_url': 'https://www.researchgate.net/search?q=', 'query': 'Critical Asian Studies Soviet Afghanistan invasion declassified archives' } ] # Set up headers to mimic browser requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', 'Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', 'Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', 'Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none' } database_search_results = [] for i, db in enumerate(academic_databases, 1): print(f'\n--- Searching {db["name"]} ({i}/{len(academic_databases)}) ---') # Construct search URL search_url = db['search_url'] + quote(db['query']) print(f'Search URL: {search_url}') try: # Add delay to be respectful if i > 1: print('Waiting 3 seconds between requests...') time.sleep(3) response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=25) print(f'Response status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: print(f'‚úì Successfully accessed {db["name"]} (Content: {len(response.content):,} bytes)') # Save the raw HTML for analysis html_file = f'workspace/{db["name"].lower().replace(" ", "_")}_search_results.html' with open(html_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved HTML content to: {html_file}') # Parse the HTML to look for relevant results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for result titles and links (different patterns for each database) result_elements = [] if 'jstor' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h3', 'h4'], class_=lambda x: x and ('title' in x.lower() or 'result' in x.lower())) elif 'muse' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h2', 'h3'], class_=lambda x: x and ('title' in x.lower() or 'citation' in x.lower())) elif 'academia' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3'], class_=lambda x: x and 'title' in x.lower()) elif 'researchgate' in db['name'].lower(): result_elements = soup.find_all(['h3', 'h4'], class_=lambda x: x and 'title' in x.lower()) # Also try generic approaches if not result_elements: result_elements = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4'], string=lambda text: text and any(keyword in text.lower() for keyword in ['afghanistan', 'soviet', 'critical asian'])) print(f'Found {len(result_elements)} potential result elements') # Extract and analyze results db_results = [] for j, element in enumerate(result_elements[:5], 1): # Limit to first 5 results title_text = element.get_text().strip() # Look for associated links link_element = element.find('a', href=True) if not link_element: link_element = element.find_parent().find('a', href=True) if element.find_parent() else None result_url = '' if link_element: href = link_element.get('href') if href.startswith('http'): result_url = href else: # Construct full URL base_url = f"https://{db['search_url'].split('/')[2]}" result_url = urljoin(base_url, href) # Check relevance relevance_keywords = ['critical asian studies', 'afghanistan', 'soviet', '1979', 'defensive', 'invasion', 'archival', 'declassified'] found_keywords = [kw for kw in relevance_keywords if kw in title_text.lower()] if found_keywords: # Only include results with relevant keywords result_data = { 'database': db['name'], 'title': title_text, 'url': result_url, 'relevance_keywords': found_keywords, 'relevance_score': len(found_keywords) } db_results.append(result_data) print(f' Result {j}: {title_text[:80]}...') print(f' Keywords: {found_keywords}') print(f' URL: {result_url}') database_search_results.extend(db_results) # Look for any direct mentions of "Critical Asian Studies" in the page content page_text = soup.get_text().lower() cas_mentions = page_text.count('critical asian studies') afghanistan_mentions = page_text.count('afghanistan') soviet_mentions = page_text.count('soviet') print(f'Page content analysis:') print(f' "Critical Asian Studies" mentions: {cas_mentions}') print(f' "Afghanistan" mentions: {afghanistan_mentions}') print(f' "Soviet" mentions: {soviet_mentions}') if cas_mentions > 0 and afghanistan_mentions > 0: print('üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE: Page contains both Critical Asian Studies and Afghanistan content!') elif response.status_code == 403: print(f'‚ùå Access forbidden to {db["name"]} (403 error)') elif response.status_code == 429: print(f'‚ùå Rate limited by {db["name"]} (429 error)') else: print(f'‚ùå Unexpected status code {response.status_code} from {db["name"]}') except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e: print(f'‚ùå Network error accessing {db["name"]}: {str(e)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Unexpected error with {db["name"]}: {str(e)}') # Consolidate and analyze all results print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED DATABASE SEARCH RESULTS ===') print(f'Total results found across all databases: {len(database_search_results)}') if database_search_results: # Sort by relevance score database_search_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print('\n--- TOP RESULTS BY RELEVANCE ---') for i, result in enumerate(database_search_results[:5], 1): print(f'\nResult {i} (Score: {result["relevance_score"]}):') print(f'Database: {result["database"]}') print(f'Title: {result["title"]}') print(f'URL: {result["url"]}') print(f'Keywords: {result["relevance_keywords"]}') print('-' * 80) # Save consolidated results consolidated_data = { 'search_objective': 'Find Critical Asian Studies article analyzing Soviet defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'search_method': 'Direct academic database access without APIs', 'databases_searched': [db['name'] for db in academic_databases], 'total_results_found': len(database_search_results), 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'top_results': database_search_results[:10], 'search_queries_used': [db['query'] for db in academic_databases] } results_file = 'workspace/direct_database_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(consolidated_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Consolidated results saved to: {results_file}') # Check if any results specifically mention Critical Asian Studies journal cas_specific_results = [r for r in database_search_results if 'critical asian studies' in r['title'].lower()] if cas_specific_results: print(f'\nüéØ FOUND {len(cas_specific_results)} RESULTS SPECIFICALLY MENTIONING CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES:') for result in cas_specific_results: print(f' - {result["title"]}') print(f' Database: {result["database"]}') print(f' URL: {result["url"]}') else: print('\n‚ö† No results specifically mention "Critical Asian Studies" journal') else: print('‚ùå No relevant results found in any database') # Alternative Strategy: Manual research compilation print('\n=== MANUAL RESEARCH COMPILATION STRATEGY ===') print('Creating comprehensive research guide for manual article identification') manual_research_guide = { 'target_article_characteristics': { 'journal': 'Critical Asian Studies', 'publisher': 'Taylor & Francis', 'publication_period': '2010-2023 (when Soviet archives became declassified)', 'topic': 'Soviet defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'methodology': 'Analysis of declassified Soviet archival materials', 'argument': 'Soviet invasion was defensive rather than aggressive expansion' }, 'search_strategies': { 'direct_journal_contact': { 'method': 'Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office', 'email_template': 'Request assistance locating article analyzing declassified Soviet archives on Afghanistan invasion defensive motives', 'journal_contact': 'https://www.tandfonline.com/journals/rcra20' }, 'institutional_library_access': { 'databases_to_check': [ 'Academic Search Complete (EBSCO)', 'Humanities International Complete', 'Historical Abstracts', 'JSTOR (full institutional access)', 'Project MUSE (full access)', 'Taylor & Francis Online (institutional subscription)' ], 'search_terms': [ '"Critical Asian Studies" AND Afghanistan AND Soviet AND defensive', '"Critical Asian Studies" AND 1979 AND invasion AND archival', 'Afghanistan Soviet defensive motives declassified archives' ] }, 'author_identification_approach': { 'method': 'Search for scholars specializing in Soviet-Afghan relations', 'potential_author_fields': [ 'Soviet/Russian history specialists', 'Cold War historians', 'Central Asian studies experts', 'Military history scholars', 'International relations theorists' ] } }, 'verification_criteria': { 'must_have_elements': [ 'Published in Critical Asian Studies journal', 'Uses declassified Soviet archival materials', 'Argues defensive rather than offensive motives', 'Focuses on 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'Published between 2010-2023' ] } } guide_file = 'workspace/comprehensive_manual_research_guide.json' with open(guide_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_research_guide, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Comprehensive manual research guide saved to: {guide_file}') print('\n=== SEARCH COMPLETION SUMMARY ===') print('Objective: Locate Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives for Afghanistan invasion') print('Methods implemented:') print(' 1. ‚úì Workspace data analysis completed') print(' 2. ‚úì Direct academic database searches conducted (4 databases)') print(' 3. ‚úì HTML content saved for offline analysis') print(' 4. ‚úì Comprehensive manual research guide created') print('\nStatus: Alternative search strategies implemented to bypass API limitations') print('Next steps: Review saved HTML files and follow manual research guide for article identification') print('\nFiles created in workspace:') for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if any(keyword in file for keyword in ['search', 'results', 'guide']): print(f' - {file}')

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== ANALYZING SAVED HTML CONTENT FOR CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE ===') print('Objective: Extract article information from accessible database HTML files') print('Focus: Look for Critical Asian Studies articles on Afghanistan/Soviet topics\n') # First, let's check what files we have in workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) print(f'All workspace files ({len(all_files)}): {all_files}') else: print('Workspace directory not found') os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) # Look for HTML files from our database searches html_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f'\nFound {len(html_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, html_file in enumerate(html_files, 1): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f'{i}. {html_file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') # Analyze each HTML file for Critical Asian Studies content analysis_results = [] for html_file in html_files: print(f'\n=== ANALYZING {html_file.upper()} ===') file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) try: with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Loaded HTML content: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for cleaner text analysis for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Get clean text content page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() print(f'Clean text content: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for key terms key_terms = { 'critical_asian_studies': ['critical asian studies', 'cas journal'], 'afghanistan': ['afghanistan', 'afghan'], 'soviet': ['soviet', 'ussr', 'soviet union'], 'invasion_1979': ['1979', 'invasion', 'intervention'], 'defensive': ['defensive', 'defense', 'defensive motives'], 'archival': ['archival', 'archives', 'declassified', 'documents'] } term_counts = {} for category, terms in key_terms.items(): total_count = sum(page_text_lower.count(term) for term in terms) term_counts[category] = total_count print(f'{category}: {total_count} mentions') # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = sum(min(count, 5) for count in term_counts.values()) # Cap each category at 5 print(f'Overall relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') # Look for specific article patterns print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR ARTICLE PATTERNS ---') # Find potential article titles (look for headings containing our keywords) article_candidates = [] # Search for headings that might be article titles headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) print(f'Found {len(headings)} headings to analyze') for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() heading_lower = heading_text.lower() # Check if heading contains relevant keywords has_afghanistan = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['afghanistan', 'afghan']) has_soviet = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['soviet', 'ussr']) has_cas = 'critical asian studies' in heading_lower if (has_afghanistan and has_soviet) or has_cas: # Look for associated links link_element = heading.find('a', href=True) if not link_element and heading.parent: link_element = heading.parent.find('a', href=True) article_url = '' if link_element: href = link_element.get('href') if href: if href.startswith('http'): article_url = href else: # Try to construct full URL based on the database if 'academia' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.academia.edu{href}' if href.startswith('/') else href elif 'muse' in html_file: article_url = f'https://muse.jhu.edu{href}' if href.startswith('/') else href candidate = { 'title': heading_text, 'url': article_url, 'source_file': html_file, 'has_afghanistan': has_afghanistan, 'has_soviet': has_soviet, 'has_cas': has_cas, 'heading_tag': heading.name } article_candidates.append(candidate) print(f' ‚úì CANDIDATE: {heading_text[:100]}...') print(f' Afghanistan: {has_afghanistan}, Soviet: {has_soviet}, CAS: {has_cas}') if article_url: print(f' URL: {article_url}') # Also search for text patterns that might indicate article citations print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR CITATION PATTERNS ---') # Look for patterns like "Critical Asian Studies, Vol. X, No. Y" citation_patterns = [ r'critical asian studies[,\s]+vol\.?\s*\d+', r'critical asian studies[,\s]+volume\s*\d+', r'critical asian studies.*\d{4}', # CAS with year r'afghanistan.*soviet.*1979', r'soviet.*afghanistan.*defensive' ] citation_matches = [] for pattern in citation_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE) for match in matches: # Extract surrounding context start = max(0, match.start() - 100) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 100) context = page_text[start:end].strip() citation_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'matched_text': match.group(), 'context': context }) print(f' ‚úì CITATION MATCH: {match.group()}') print(f' Context: {context[:150]}...') # Store analysis results file_analysis = { 'filename': html_file, 'file_size': len(html_content), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'term_counts': term_counts, 'article_candidates': article_candidates, 'citation_matches': citation_matches, 'total_candidates': len(article_candidates), 'total_citations': len(citation_matches) } analysis_results.append(file_analysis) print(f'\nSUMMARY for {html_file}:') print(f' Relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') print(f' Article candidates: {len(article_candidates)}') print(f' Citation matches: {len(citation_matches)}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') continue # Consolidate and rank all findings print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'Analyzed {len(analysis_results)} HTML files') # Sort by relevance score analysis_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) all_candidates = [] all_citations = [] for result in analysis_results: all_candidates.extend(result['article_candidates']) all_citations.extend(result['citation_matches']) print(f'Total article candidates found: {len(all_candidates)}') print(f'Total citation matches found: {len(all_citations)}') # Show top candidates if all_candidates: print('\n=== TOP ARTICLE CANDIDATES ===') # Sort candidates by relevance (prefer those with CAS + Afghanistan + Soviet) def candidate_score(candidate): score = 0 if candidate['has_cas']: score += 10 if candidate['has_afghanistan']: score += 5 if candidate['has_soviet']: score += 5 if candidate['url']: score += 2 return score all_candidates.sort(key=candidate_score, reverse=True) for i, candidate in enumerate(all_candidates[:5], 1): print(f'\nCandidate {i} (Score: {candidate_score(candidate)}):') print(f'Title: {candidate["title"]}') print(f'Source: {candidate["source_file"]}') print(f'URL: {candidate["url"] if candidate["url"] else "No URL found"}') print(f'Relevance: CAS={candidate["has_cas"]}, Afghanistan={candidate["has_afghanistan"]}, Soviet={candidate["has_soviet"]}') print('-' * 80) else: print('‚ùå No article candidates found in HTML files') # Show citation matches if all_citations: print('\n=== CITATION PATTERN MATCHES ===') for i, citation in enumerate(all_citations[:3], 1): print(f'\nCitation {i}:') print(f'Matched: {citation["matched_text"]}') print(f'Context: {citation["context"]}') print('-' * 60) else: print('‚ùå No citation patterns found') # Save comprehensive analysis final_analysis = { 'analysis_objective': 'Extract Critical Asian Studies articles on Soviet Afghanistan invasion from saved HTML files', 'files_analyzed': len(analysis_results), 'total_candidates': len(all_candidates), 'total_citations': len(all_citations), 'file_analysis_details': analysis_results, 'top_candidates': all_candidates[:10] if all_candidates else [], 'citation_matches': all_citations[:10] if all_citations else [], 'analysis_timestamp': '2025-01-21 14:30:00' } analysis_file = 'workspace/html_content_analysis_results.json' with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_analysis, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Complete analysis saved to: {analysis_file}') # Check if we found any promising leads if all_candidates or all_citations: print('\nüéØ PROMISING LEADS FOUND!') if all_candidates: top_candidate = all_candidates[0] print(f'Top candidate: {top_candidate["title"]}') if top_candidate['url']: print(f'Direct access URL available: {top_candidate["url"]}') print('\nRECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:') print('1. Review the top candidates for exact bibliographic details') print('2. Access candidate URLs directly for full article information') print('3. Use citation contexts to identify specific journal volumes/issues') else: print('\n‚ö† LIMITED SUCCESS: No specific article candidates identified') print('The HTML content may not contain detailed search results') print('Consider following the manual research guide for direct journal access') print('\n=== HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETED ===') print('Status: Systematic analysis of saved database content completed') print('Objective: Extract bibliographic details of Critical Asian Studies article on Soviet defensive motives')
Execution Output
Code Output: === ANALYZING SAVED HTML CONTENT FOR CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE === Objective: Extract article information from accessible database HTML files Focus: Look for Critical Asian Studies articles on Afghanistan/Soviet topics All workspace files (12): ['project_muse_search_results.html', 'bulletin_concerned_asian_scholars_search_results.json',
