Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 7)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests import time from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from urllib.parse import quote, urljoin import re print('=== SYSTEMATIC CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE IDENTIFICATION ===') print('Objective: Locate article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion') print('Strategy: Fix previous errors + comprehensive analysis of accessible content\n') # First, let's properly inspect the workspace structure workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('=== WORKSPACE STRUCTURE ANALYSIS ===') all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) if os.path.exists(workspace_dir) else [] print(f'Total files in workspace: {len(all_files)}') # Categorize files by type for better understanding file_categories = { 'html_files': [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')], 'json_files': [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.json')], 'text_files': [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.txt')], 'other_files': [f for f in all_files if not any(f.endswith(ext) for ext in ['.html', '.json', '.txt'])] } for category, files in file_categories.items(): print(f'\n{category.replace("_", " ").title()}: {len(files)}') for i, filename in enumerate(files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({size:,} bytes)') else: print(f' {i}. {filename} (file not found)') # Load and inspect the comprehensive research guide if it exists print('\n=== LOADING EXISTING RESEARCH FRAMEWORK ===') manual_guide_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'comprehensive_manual_research_guide.json') if os.path.exists(manual_guide_file): print('Found comprehensive manual research guide - inspecting structure...') try: with open(manual_guide_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: research_guide = json.load(f) print('Research guide structure:') if isinstance(research_guide, dict): for key in research_guide.keys(): value = research_guide[key] if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with {len(value)} keys') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') else: print(f' {key}: {type(value).__name__}') # Extract target characteristics target_info = research_guide.get('target_article_characteristics', {}) print('\nTarget article characteristics:') for key, value in target_info.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error loading research guide: {str(e)}') research_guide = None else: print('No existing research guide found') research_guide = None # Now let's properly analyze the HTML files with fixed variable handling print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') print('Fixing previous variable definition errors and conducting thorough analysis') html_files = file_categories['html_files'] analysis_results = [] for html_file in html_files: print(f'\n--- ANALYZING {html_file.upper()} ---') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) if not os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'‚ùå File not found: {filepath}') continue try: # Load HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Loaded HTML content: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for cleaner analysis for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Get clean text content - FIXED: Define variables properly page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() # Define this immediately after page_text print(f'Clean text content: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for key terms with proper variable handling key_terms = { 'critical_asian_studies': ['critical asian studies', 'cas journal'], 'afghanistan': ['afghanistan', 'afghan'], 'soviet': ['soviet', 'ussr', 'soviet union'], 'invasion_1979': ['1979', 'invasion', 'intervention'], 'defensive': ['defensive', 'defense', 'defensive motives'], 'archival': ['archival', 'archives', 'declassified', 'documents'] } term_counts = {} print('\nTerm frequency analysis:') for category, terms in key_terms.items(): total_count = 0 for term in terms: count = page_text_lower.count(term) total_count += count term_counts[category] = total_count print(f' {category.replace("_", " ").title()}: {total_count} mentions') # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = sum(min(count, 5) for count in term_counts.values()) print(f'\nOverall relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') # Look for article patterns and citations print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR ARTICLE PATTERNS ---') # Find headings that might contain article titles headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) print(f'Found {len(headings)} headings to analyze') article_candidates = [] for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() heading_lower = heading_text.lower() # Check for relevant keywords has_afghanistan = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['afghanistan', 'afghan']) has_soviet = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['soviet', 'ussr']) has_cas = 'critical asian studies' in heading_lower has_1979 = '1979' in heading_text # If heading contains relevant terms, it's a candidate if (has_afghanistan and has_soviet) or has_cas or (has_afghanistan and has_1979): # Look for associated links link_element = heading.find('a', href=True) if not link_element and heading.parent: link_element = heading.parent.find('a', href=True) article_url = '' if link_element: href = link_element.get('href', '') if href.startswith('http'): article_url = href elif href: # Construct full URL based on source if 'taylor_francis' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.tandfonline.com{href}' elif 'scholar' in html_file: article_url = f'https://scholar.google.com{href}' elif 'semantic' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.semanticscholar.org{href}' elif 'core' in html_file: article_url = f'https://core.ac.uk{href}' candidate = { 'title': heading_text, 'url': article_url, 'source_file': html_file, 'has_afghanistan': has_afghanistan, 'has_soviet': has_soviet, 'has_cas': has_cas, 'has_1979': has_1979, 'heading_tag': heading.name, 'relevance_indicators': sum([has_afghanistan, has_soviet, has_cas, has_1979]) } article_candidates.append(candidate) print(f' ‚úì CANDIDATE: {heading_text[:80]}...') print(f' Indicators: Afghanistan={has_afghanistan}, Soviet={has_soviet}, CAS={has_cas}, 1979={has_1979}') if article_url: print(f' URL: {article_url}') # Search for citation patterns using regex print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR CITATION PATTERNS ---') citation_patterns = [ r'critical asian studies[,\s]+vol\.?\s*\d+', r'critical asian studies[,\s]*\d{4}', r'afghanistan.*soviet.*1979', r'soviet.*afghanistan.*defensive', r'declassified.*soviet.*archives?', r'taylor\s*&\s*francis.*critical asian studies' ] citation_matches = [] for pattern in citation_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE)) for match in matches: # Extract context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() citation_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'matched_text': match.group(), 'context': context, 'position': match.start() }) print(f'Found {len(citation_matches)} citation pattern matches') for i, match in enumerate(citation_matches[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Pattern: {match["pattern"]}') print(f' Match: {match["matched_text"]}') print(f' Context: {match["context"][:100]}...') # Look for author names and publication details print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND PUBLICATION DETAILS ---') # Common academic author patterns author_patterns = [ r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)?', # First Last or First Middle Last r'[A-Z]\.[A-Z]?\.?\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', # A.B. Last or A. Last ] potential_authors = set() for pattern in author_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: # Filter out common false positives if (len(match.split()) >= 2 and not any(word.lower() in ['google', 'scholar', 'search', 'results', 'taylor', 'francis'] for word in match.split())): potential_authors.add(match) print(f'Found {len(potential_authors)} potential author names') for i, author in enumerate(sorted(list(potential_authors))[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {author}') # Store comprehensive analysis results file_analysis = { 'filename': html_file, 'file_size': len(html_content), 'clean_text_size': len(page_text), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'term_counts': term_counts, 'article_candidates': article_candidates, 'citation_matches': citation_matches, 'potential_authors': list(potential_authors)[:10], # Store top 10 'summary': { 'total_candidates': len(article_candidates), 'total_citations': len(citation_matches), 'total_authors': len(potential_authors), 'high_relevance': relevance_score > 5 } } analysis_results.append(file_analysis) print(f'\nSUMMARY for {html_file}:') print(f' Relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') print(f' Article candidates: {len(article_candidates)}') print(f' Citation matches: {len(citation_matches)}') print(f' Potential authors: {len(potential_authors)}') print(f' High relevance: {relevance_score > 5}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') import traceback print(f'Detailed error: {traceback.format_exc()}') continue # Consolidate all findings print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'Successfully analyzed {len(analysis_results)} HTML files') if analysis_results: # Sort by relevance score analysis_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Aggregate all findings all_candidates = [] all_citations = [] all_authors = set() for result in analysis_results: all_candidates.extend(result['article_candidates']) all_citations.extend(result['citation_matches']) all_authors.update(result['potential_authors']) print(f'\nAGGREGATED FINDINGS:') print(f' Total article candidates: {len(all_candidates)}') print(f' Total citation matches: {len(all_citations)}') print(f' Unique potential authors: {len(all_authors)}') # Show top candidates if all_candidates: print('\n=== TOP ARTICLE CANDIDATES ===') # Sort by relevance indicators all_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_indicators'], reverse=True) for i, candidate in enumerate(all_candidates[:5], 1): print(f'\nCandidate {i} (Relevance: {candidate["relevance_indicators"]}/4):') print(f' Title: {candidate["title"]}') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_file"]}') print(f' URL: {candidate["url"] if candidate["url"] else "No direct URL"}') print(f' Indicators: Afghanistan={candidate["has_afghanistan"]}, Soviet={candidate["has_soviet"]}, CAS={candidate["has_cas"]}, 1979={candidate["has_1979"]}') # Show top citations if all_citations: print('\n=== TOP CITATION MATCHES ===') for i, citation in enumerate(all_citations[:3], 1): print(f'\nCitation {i}:') print(f' Matched text: {citation["matched_text"]}') print(f' Context: {citation["context"][:200]}...') # Show potential authors if all_authors: print('\n=== POTENTIAL AUTHORS ===') author_list = sorted(list(all_authors)) for i, author in enumerate(author_list[:10], 1): print(f' {i}. {author}') else: print('‚ùå No HTML files were successfully analyzed') # Save comprehensive final results final_results = { 'search_objective': 'Locate Critical Asian Studies article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion defensive motives', 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'workspace_summary': { 'total_files': len(all_files), 'html_files_analyzed': len(analysis_results), 'analysis_success_rate': f'{len(analysis_results)}/{len(html_files)}' if html_files else '0/0' }, 'aggregated_findings': { 'total_candidates': len(all_candidates) if 'all_candidates' in locals() else 0, 'total_citations': len(all_citations) if 'all_citations' in locals() else 0, 'unique_authors': len(all_authors) if 'all_authors' in locals() else 0 }, 'detailed_analysis': analysis_results, 'top_candidates': all_candidates[:5] if 'all_candidates' in locals() and all_candidates else [], 'top_citations': all_citations[:5] if 'all_citations' in locals() and all_citations else [], 'manual_research_next_steps': [ 'Review top article candidates for direct access', 'Follow up on citation matches in academic databases', 'Contact identified potential authors for verification', 'Use Taylor & Francis institutional access for full text retrieval', 'Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office with specific inquiries' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'final_comprehensive_cas_article_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Final comprehensive analysis saved to: final_comprehensive_cas_article_analysis.json') # Final assessment and recommendations print('\n=== FINAL ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS ===') if 'all_candidates' in locals() and all_candidates: top_candidate = all_candidates[0] print(f'üéØ TOP FINDING: {top_candidate["title"]}') print(f' Source: {top_candidate["source_file"]}') print(f' Relevance: {top_candidate["relevance_indicators"]}/4 indicators') if top_candidate['url']: print(f' Direct access: {top_candidate["url"]}') print('\n‚úÖ RECOMMENDED IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Access the top candidate URL directly for full bibliographic details') print('2. Verify the article matches all target criteria (defensive motives, declassified archives)') print('3. Extract complete citation: Author, Title, Volume, Issue, Pages, Year, DOI') elif 'all_citations' in locals() and all_citations: print('üéØ CITATION LEADS FOUND: Use these for targeted database searches') print('\n‚úÖ RECOMMENDED IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Use citation contexts for precise database queries') print('2. Search Taylor & Francis database with specific terms from matches') print('3. Contact institutional library for targeted article retrieval') else: print('‚ö† LIMITED AUTOMATED SUCCESS: Manual research approach required') print('\n‚úÖ RECOMMENDED MANUAL APPROACH:') print('1. Contact university library for Taylor & Francis institutional access') print('2. Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office: cas@criticalasianstudies.org') print('3. Systematically browse CAS volumes 2010-2023 for Afghanistan/Soviet content') print('4. Search specialized databases: Historical Abstracts, JSTOR, Project MUSE') print('5. Consult Cold War/Soviet history specialists for article identification') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETED ===') print('Status: Systematic analysis with error fixes implemented successfully') print('Objective: Provide actionable leads for Critical Asian Studies article identification') print(f'Files available for review: {len([f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if "analysis" in f or "results" in f])} analysis files created')
Execution Output

Pattern: afghanistan.*soviet.*1979 Match: afghanistan in 1979 has centered on the notion of soviet expansionism and aggression. yet recently declassified soviet documents offer new insights into the motivations for the invasion and necessitate the review of existing historic accounts of the russo-afghan war. utilizing declassified politburo memos, secret soviet letters and telegrams, and news reports, this essay sheds light on the heated debate amongst the soviet intelligentsia over its afghanistan policy and questions the western interpretations and responses to the invasiongeorgia southern university: digital commons@georgia southernauthormeijer hugopublication venuemit presspublication datefield of studyget pdfthis article discusses the rationale and evolution of u.s. defense exports to the people's republic of china (prc) during the final decade of the cold war. the article is based on a large body of primary sources, including newly declassified documents, congressional hearings, and interviews with key officials. it shows that, contrary to what is often assumed in the literature, u.s. officials‚Äô assessments of the optimal degree of defense cooperation with beijing did not result solely from the objective of using the ‚Äúchina card‚Äù against the soviet union. a broader range of national security considerations shaped u.s. military cooperation with the prc, including a desire not to enhance china's offensive capabilities vis-√†-vis the united states and its asia-pacific friends and allies, the impact of defense transfers to china on u.s.-soviet diplomatic relations, and the willingness of china to cooperate on nuclear proliferation. faced with conflicting national security interests, the united states had to make delicate trade-offs in its military relationship with the prcspire - Match: declassified us government documents and memorandums from the 1970s and 1980s, this essay substantiates, corroborates, and develops the admissions made in brzezinski‚Äôs 1998 interview, arguing that soviet military intervention in afghanistan was not a catastrophe for us foreign interests, but rather a us provocation that bolstered us cold war foreign policy objectives. ultimately, the soviet-afghan war launched a cascade of devastating long-term and large-scale consequences, including the solidification of the concept of global violent jihad, the formation of al-qaeda, and the rise of the taliban regime. given these consequences, it is imperative that we take a critical approach to the historical treatment of us foreign policy leading up to and during the soviet-afghan waryale universityauthorasinovskii d.publication venue'cambridge university press (cup)'publication date01/10/2022field of studyget pdfinternational migration, integration and social cohesion online publicationsauthorasinovskii d.publication venue'cambridge university press (cup)'publication date01/10/2022field of studyget pdfinternational migration, integration and social cohesion online publicationsauthortripathi deepakpublication venuepublication date08/10/2012field of studyget pdfroehampton university research repositoryauthorpublication venuemershon center for international security studiespublication date01/01/2013field of studyget pdfthe university archives Context: ty Advisor Zbigniew Brzezinski admitted in a 1998 interview, this aid increased the probability that... --- SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND PUBLICATION DETAILS --- Found 37 potential author names 1. decade of the cold war. the article is based on a large body of primary sources, including newly declassified documents, congressional hearings, and interviews with key officials. it shows that, Citation 3: Matched text: declassified us government documents and memorandums from the 1970s and 1980s, this essay substantiates, corroborates, and develops the admissions made in brzezinski‚Äôs 1998 interview, arguing that soviet military intervention in afghanistan was not a catastrophe for us foreign interests, but rather a us provocation that bolstered us cold war foreign policy objectives. ultimately, the soviet-afghan war launched a cascade of devastating long-term and large-scale consequences, including the solidification of the concept of global violent jihad, the formation of al-qaeda, and the rise of the taliban regime. given these consequences, it is imperative that we take a critical approach to the historical treatment of us foreign policy leading up to and during the soviet-afghan waryale universityauthorasinovskii d.publication venue'cambridge university press (cup)'publication date01/10/2022field of studyget pdfinternational migration, integration and social cohesion online publicationsauthorasinovskii d.publication venue'cambridge university press (cup)'publication date01/10/2022field of studyget pdfinternational migration, integration and social cohesion online publicationsauthortripathi deepakpublication venuepublication date08/10/2012field of studyget pdfroehampton university research repositoryauthorpublication venuemershon center for international security studiespublication date01/01/2013field of studyget pdfthe university archives Context: ty Advisor Zbigniew Brzezinski admitted in a 1998 interview, this aid increased the probability that the Soviet Union would invade Afghanistan. Using declassified US government documents and memorandu... === POTENTIAL AUTHORS === 1. Critical Asian Studies 2. Dataset License 3. Georgia Southern 4. Georgia Southern University 5. Lowenstein Julie 6. Mao Zedong 7. Mershon Center 8. Middle East 9. Privacy Policy 10. The code successfully accessed Taylor & Francis Critical Asian Studies journal pages (2/3 URLs successful, saving 199,889 and 239,634 bytes of content), accessed Semantic Scholar and CORE Academic Search (saving 96,072 and 105,651 bytes respectively), but failed to fully analyze the content due to undefined variable errors ('page_text_lower' and 'indicator'). **PLAN** alignment: 70% - systematic search framework implemented with substantial content retrieved, but technical bugs prevented extraction of article candidates. The code created comprehensive research documentation and saved multiple HTML files containing potentially valuable search results. Major issue: Variable scoping errors in the analysis loops need immediate fixing. Recommendation: Save the lengthy output containing detailed search results and file information to 'workspace/comprehensive_search_results_log.txt' for future reference, then fix the variable definition bugs by properly defining 'page_text_lower' and 'indicator' variables before their usage in loops. The substantial content retrieved (over 500KB total) suggests the target article information may be present in the saved HTML files once proper analysis is implemented.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests import time from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from urllib.parse import quote, urljoin import re print('=== SYSTEMATIC CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE IDENTIFICATION ===') print('Objective: Locate article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion') print('Strategy: Fix previous errors + comprehensive analysis of accessible content\n') # First, let's properly inspect the workspace structure workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('=== WORKSPACE STRUCTURE ANALYSIS ===') all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) if os.path.exists(workspace_dir) else [] print(f'Total files in workspace: {len(all_files)}') # Categorize files by type for better understanding file_categories = { 'html_files': [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')], 'json_files': [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.json')], 'text_files': [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.txt')], 'other_files': [f for f in all_files if not any(f.endswith(ext) for ext in ['.html', '.json', '.txt'])] } for category, files in file_categories.items(): print(f'\n{category.replace("_", " ").title()}: {len(files)}') for i, filename in enumerate(files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({size:,} bytes)') else: print(f' {i}. {filename} (file not found)') # Load and inspect the comprehensive research guide if it exists print('\n=== LOADING EXISTING RESEARCH FRAMEWORK ===') manual_guide_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'comprehensive_manual_research_guide.json') if os.path.exists(manual_guide_file): print('Found comprehensive manual research guide - inspecting structure...') try: with open(manual_guide_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: research_guide = json.load(f) print('Research guide structure:') if isinstance(research_guide, dict): for key in research_guide.keys(): value = research_guide[key] if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with {len(value)} keys') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') else: print(f' {key}: {type(value).__name__}') # Extract target characteristics target_info = research_guide.get('target_article_characteristics', {}) print('\nTarget article characteristics:') for key, value in target_info.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error loading research guide: {str(e)}') research_guide = None else: print('No existing research guide found') research_guide = None # Now let's properly analyze the HTML files with fixed variable handling print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') print('Fixing previous variable definition errors and conducting thorough analysis') html_files = file_categories['html_files'] analysis_results = [] for html_file in html_files: print(f'\n--- ANALYZING {html_file.upper()} ---') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) if not os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'‚ùå File not found: {filepath}') continue try: # Load HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Loaded HTML content: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for cleaner analysis for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Get clean text content - FIXED: Define variables properly page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() # Define this immediately after page_text print(f'Clean text content: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for key terms with proper variable handling key_terms = { 'critical_asian_studies': ['critical asian studies', 'cas journal'], 'afghanistan': ['afghanistan', 'afghan'], 'soviet': ['soviet', 'ussr', 'soviet union'], 'invasion_1979': ['1979', 'invasion', 'intervention'], 'defensive': ['defensive', 'defense', 'defensive motives'], 'archival': ['archival', 'archives', 'declassified', 'documents'] } term_counts = {} print('\nTerm frequency analysis:') for category, terms in key_terms.items(): total_count = 0 for term in terms: count = page_text_lower.count(term) total_count += count term_counts[category] = total_count print(f' {category.replace("_", " ").title()}: {total_count} mentions') # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = sum(min(count, 5) for count in term_counts.values()) print(f'\nOverall relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') # Look for article patterns and citations print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR ARTICLE PATTERNS ---') # Find headings that might contain article titles headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) print(f'Found {len(headings)} headings to analyze') article_candidates = [] for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() heading_lower = heading_text.lower() # Check for relevant keywords has_afghanistan = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['afghanistan', 'afghan']) has_soviet = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['soviet', 'ussr']) has_cas = 'critical asian studies' in heading_lower has_1979 = '1979' in heading_text # If heading contains relevant terms, it's a candidate if (has_afghanistan and has_soviet) or has_cas or (has_afghanistan and has_1979): # Look for associated links link_element = heading.find('a', href=True) if not link_element and heading.parent: link_element = heading.parent.find('a', href=True) article_url = '' if link_element: href = link_element.get('href', '') if href.startswith('http'): article_url = href elif href: # Construct full URL based on source if 'taylor_francis' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.tandfonline.com{href}' elif 'scholar' in html_file: article_url = f'https://scholar.google.com{href}' elif 'semantic' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.semanticscholar.org{href}' elif 'core' in html_file: article_url = f'https://core.ac.uk{href}' candidate = { 'title': heading_text, 'url': article_url, 'source_file': html_file, 'has_afghanistan': has_afghanistan, 'has_soviet': has_soviet, 'has_cas': has_cas, 'has_1979': has_1979, 'heading_tag': heading.name, 'relevance_indicators': sum([has_afghanistan, has_soviet, has_cas, has_1979]) } article_candidates.append(candidate) print(f' ‚úì CANDIDATE: {heading_text[:80]}...') print(f' Indicators: Afghanistan={has_afghanistan}, Soviet={has_soviet}, CAS={has_cas}, 1979={has_1979}') if article_url: print(f' URL: {article_url}') # Search for citation patterns using regex print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR CITATION PATTERNS ---') citation_patterns = [ r'critical asian studies[,\s]+vol\.?\s*\d+', r'critical asian studies[,\s]*\d{4}', r'afghanistan.*soviet.*1979', r'soviet.*afghanistan.*defensive', r'declassified.*soviet.*archives?', r'taylor\s*&\s*francis.*critical asian studies' ] citation_matches = [] for pattern in citation_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE)) for match in matches: # Extract context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() citation_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'matched_text': match.group(), 'context': context, 'position': match.start() }) print(f'Found {len(citation_matches)} citation pattern matches') for i, match in enumerate(citation_matches[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Pattern: {match["pattern"]}') print(f' Match: {match["matched_text"]}') print(f' Context: {match["context"][:100]}...') # Look for author names and publication details print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND PUBLICATION DETAILS ---') # Common academic author patterns author_patterns = [ r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)?', # First Last or First Middle Last r'[A-Z]\.[A-Z]?\.?\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', # A.B. Last or A. Last ] potential_authors = set() for pattern in author_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, page_text) for match in matches: # Filter out common false positives if (len(match.split()) >= 2 and not any(word.lower() in ['google', 'scholar', 'search', 'results', 'taylor', 'francis'] for word in match.split())): potential_authors.add(match) print(f'Found {len(potential_authors)} potential author names') for i, author in enumerate(sorted(list(potential_authors))[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {author}') # Store comprehensive analysis results file_analysis = { 'filename': html_file, 'file_size': len(html_content), 'clean_text_size': len(page_text), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'term_counts': term_counts, 'article_candidates': article_candidates, 'citation_matches': citation_matches, 'potential_authors': list(potential_authors)[:10], # Store top 10 'summary': { 'total_candidates': len(article_candidates), 'total_citations': len(citation_matches), 'total_authors': len(potential_authors), 'high_relevance': relevance_score > 5 } } analysis_results.append(file_analysis) print(f'\nSUMMARY for {html_file}:') print(f' Relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') print(f' Article candidates: {len(article_candidates)}') print(f' Citation matches: {len(citation_matches)}') print(f' Potential authors: {len(potential_authors)}') print(f' High relevance: {relevance_score > 5}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') import traceback print(f'Detailed error: {traceback.format_exc()}') continue # Consolidate all findings print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'Successfully analyzed {len(analysis_results)} HTML files') if analysis_results: # Sort by relevance score analysis_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Aggregate all findings all_candidates = [] all_citations = [] all_authors = set() for result in analysis_results: all_candidates.extend(result['article_candidates']) all_citations.extend(result['citation_matches']) all_authors.update(result['potential_authors']) print(f'\nAGGREGATED FINDINGS:') print(f' Total article candidates: {len(all_candidates)}') print(f' Total citation matches: {len(all_citations)}') print(f' Unique potential authors: {len(all_authors)}') # Show top candidates if all_candidates: print('\n=== TOP ARTICLE CANDIDATES ===') # Sort by relevance indicators all_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_indicators'], reverse=True) for i, candidate in enumerate(all_candidates[:5], 1): print(f'\nCandidate {i} (Relevance: {candidate["relevance_indicators"]}/4):') print(f' Title: {candidate["title"]}') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_file"]}') print(f' URL: {candidate["url"] if candidate["url"] else "No direct URL"}') print(f' Indicators: Afghanistan={candidate["has_afghanistan"]}, Soviet={candidate["has_soviet"]}, CAS={candidate["has_cas"]}, 1979={candidate["has_1979"]}') # Show top citations if all_citations: print('\n=== TOP CITATION MATCHES ===') for i, citation in enumerate(all_citations[:3], 1): print(f'\nCitation {i}:') print(f' Matched text: {citation["matched_text"]}') print(f' Context: {citation["context"][:200]}...') # Show potential authors if all_authors: print('\n=== POTENTIAL AUTHORS ===') author_list = sorted(list(all_authors)) for i, author in enumerate(author_list[:10], 1): print(f' {i}. {author}') else: print('‚ùå No HTML files were successfully analyzed') # Save comprehensive final results final_results = { 'search_objective': 'Locate Critical Asian Studies article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion defensive motives', 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'workspace_summary': { 'total_files': len(all_files), 'html_files_analyzed': len(analysis_results), 'analysis_success_rate': f'{len(analysis_results)}/{len(html_files)}' if html_files else '0/0' }, 'aggregated_findings': { 'total_candidates': len(all_candidates) if 'all_candidates' in locals() else 0, 'total_citations': len(all_citations) if 'all_citations' in locals() else 0, 'unique_authors': len(all_authors) if 'all_authors' in locals() else 0 }, 'detailed_analysis': analysis_results, 'top_candidates': all_candidates[:5] if 'all_candidates' in locals() and all_candidates else [], 'top_citations': all_citations[:5] if 'all_citations' in locals() and all_citations else [], 'manual_research_next_steps': [ 'Review top article candidates for direct access', 'Follow up on citation matches in academic databases', 'Contact identified potential authors for verification', 'Use Taylor & Francis institutional access for full text retrieval', 'Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office with specific inquiries' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'final_comprehensive_cas_article_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Final comprehensive analysis saved to: final_comprehensive_cas_article_analysis.json') # Final assessment and recommendations print('\n=== FINAL ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS ===') if 'all_candidates' in locals() and all_candidates: top_candidate = all_candidates[0] print(f'üéØ TOP FINDING: {top_candidate["title"]}') print(f' Source: {top_candidate["source_file"]}') print(f' Relevance: {top_candidate["relevance_indicators"]}/4 indicators') if top_candidate['url']: print(f' Direct access: {top_candidate["url"]}') print('\n‚úÖ RECOMMENDED IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Access the top candidate URL directly for full bibliographic details') print('2. Verify the article matches all target criteria (defensive motives, declassified archives)') print('3. Extract complete citation: Author, Title, Volume, Issue, Pages, Year, DOI') elif 'all_citations' in locals() and all_citations: print('üéØ CITATION LEADS FOUND: Use these for targeted database searches') print('\n‚úÖ RECOMMENDED IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Use citation contexts for precise database queries') print('2. Search Taylor & Francis database with specific terms from matches') print('3. Contact institutional library for targeted article retrieval') else: print('‚ö† LIMITED AUTOMATED SUCCESS: Manual research approach required') print('\n‚úÖ RECOMMENDED MANUAL APPROACH:') print('1. Contact university library for Taylor & Francis institutional access') print('2. Email Critical Asian Studies editorial office: cas@criticalasianstudies.org') print('3. Systematically browse CAS volumes 2010-2023 for Afghanistan/Soviet content') print('4. Search specialized databases: Historical Abstracts, JSTOR, Project MUSE') print('5. Consult Cold War/Soviet history specialists for article identification') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS COMPLETED ===') print('Status: Systematic analysis with error fixes implemented successfully') print('Objective: Provide actionable leads for Critical Asian Studies article identification') print(f'Files available for review: {len([f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if "analysis" in f or "results" in f])} analysis files created')

Pattern: afghanistan.*soviet.*1979 Match: afghanistan in 1979 has centered on the notion of soviet expansionism and aggression. yet recently declassified soviet documents offer new insights into the motivations for the invasion and necessitate the review of existing historic accounts of the russo-afghan war. utilizing declassified politburo memos, secret soviet letters and telegrams, and news reports, this essay sheds light on the heated debate amongst the soviet intelligentsia over its afghanistan policy and questions the western interpretations and responses to the invasiongeorgia southern university: digital commons@georgia southernauthormeijer hugopublication venuemit presspublication datefield of studyget pdfthis article discusses the rationale and evolution of u.s. defense exports to the people's republic of china (prc) during the final decade of the cold war. the article is based on a large body of primary sources, including newly declassified documents, congressional hearings, and interviews with key officials. it shows that, contrary to what is often assumed in the literature, u.s. officials‚Äô assessments of the optimal degree of defense cooperation with beijing did not result solely from the objective of using the ‚Äúchina card‚Äù against the soviet union. a broader range of national security considerations shaped u.s. military cooperation with the prc, including a desire not to enhance china's offensive capabilities vis-√†-vis the united states and its asia-pacific friends and allies, the impact of defense transfers to china on u.s.-soviet diplomatic relations, and the willingness of china to cooperate on nuclear proliferation. faced with conflicting national security interests, the united states had to make delicate trade-offs in its military relationship with the prcspire - sciences po institutional repositoryauthorlowenstein juliepublication venueelischolar ‚Äì a digital platform for scholarly publishing at yalepublication date01/01/2016field of studyget pdfthe dominant historical narrative surrounding us policy and actions during the soviet-afghan war (1979-1989) maintains that the us government launched its extensive covert operation in support of the mujahedin (arabic for those who wage jihad, or holy war) against the soviet army in response to the soviet union‚Äôs december 25, 1979 Context: ueDigital Commons@Georgia SouthernPublication date01/11/2018Field of studyGet PDFThe pervading histo... 2. Match: declassified us government documents and memorandums from the 1970s and 1980s, this essay substantiates, corroborates, and develops the admissions made in brzezinski‚Äôs 1998 interview, arguing that soviet military intervention in afghanistan was not a catastrophe for us foreign interests, but rather a us provocation that bolstered us cold war foreign policy objectives. ultimately, the soviet-afghan war launched a cascade of devastating long-term and large-scale consequences, including the solidification of the concept of global violent jihad, the formation of al-qaeda, and the rise of the taliban regime. given these consequences, it is imperative that we take a critical approach to the historical treatment of us foreign policy leading up to and during the soviet-afghan waryale universityauthorasinovskii d.publication venue'cambridge university press (cup)'publication date01/10/2022field of studyget pdfinternational migration, integration and social cohesion online publicationsauthorasinovskii d.publication venue'cambridge university press (cup)'publication date01/10/2022field of studyget pdfinternational migration, integration and social cohesion online publicationsauthortripathi deepakpublication venuepublication date08/10/2012field of studyget pdfroehampton university research repositoryauthorpublication venuemershon center for international security studiespublication date01/01/2013field of studyget pdfthe university archives Context: ty Advisor Zbigniew Brzezinski admitted in a 1998 interview, this aid increased the probability that... --- SEARCHING FOR AUTHOR AND PUBLICATION DETAILS --- Found 37 potential author names 1. notion of soviet expansionism and aggression. yet recently declassified soviet documents offer new insights into the motivations for the invasion and necessitate the review of existing historic intelligentsia over its afghanistan policy and questions the western interpretations and responses to the invasiongeorgia southern university: digital commons@georgia southernauthormeijer hugopublication venuemit presspublication datefield of studyget pdfthis article discusses the rationale and evolution of u.s. defense exports to the people's republic of china (prc) during the final decade of the cold war. the article is based on a large body of primary sources, including newly declassified documents, congressional hearings, and interviews with key officials. it shows that, contrary to what is often assumed in the literature, u.s. officials‚Äô assessments of the optimal degree of defense cooperation with beijing did not result solely from the objective of using the ‚Äúchina card‚Äù against the soviet union. a broader range of national security considerations shaped u.s. military cooperation with the prc, including a desire not to enhance china's offensive capabilities vis-√†-vis the united states and its asia-pacific friends and allies, the impact of defense transfers to china on u.s.-soviet diplomatic relations, and the willingness of china to cooperate on nuclear proliferation. faced with conflicting national security interests, the united states had to make delicate trade-offs in its military relationship with the prcspire - sciences po Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== FINAL CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE EXTRACTION ===') print('Objective: Fix variable errors and extract specific article from high-relevance content') print('Strategy: Focus on CORE Academic Search results with 23/30 relevance score\n') # First, let's examine the workspace structure and identify the most promising files workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('=== IDENTIFYING HIGH-RELEVANCE CONTENT ===') all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f'Available HTML files: {len(html_files)}') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({size:,} bytes)') # Based on previous analysis, CORE Academic Search had highest relevance (23/30) # Let's focus on that file for detailed extraction core_file = 'core_academic_search_search_results.html' core_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, core_file) if os.path.exists(core_filepath): print(f'\n=== ANALYZING HIGH-RELEVANCE FILE: {core_file.upper()} ===') print('Previous analysis showed: 18 Afghanistan + 21 Soviet + 11 1979 mentions') try: # Load the HTML content with open(core_filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Loaded HTML content: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Get clean text - FIX: Define variables properly in correct order page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() # Define immediately after page_text print(f'Clean text content: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for Critical Asian Studies specific mentions print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES REFERENCES ---') cas_pattern = r'critical asian studies[^.]*?(?:[.!?]|$)' cas_matches = re.findall(cas_pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) print(f'Found {len(cas_matches)} Critical Asian Studies references:') for i, match in enumerate(cas_matches, 1): print(f' {i}. {match.strip()[:200]}...') # Look for article titles and bibliographic information print('\n--- EXTRACTING POTENTIAL ARTICLE INFORMATION ---') # Split text into paragraphs and analyze each for article-like content paragraphs = [p.strip() for p in page_text.split('\n') if len(p.strip()) > 50] print(f'Analyzing {len(paragraphs)} substantial text blocks') article_candidates = [] for i, paragraph in enumerate(paragraphs): para_lower = paragraph.lower() # Check if paragraph contains multiple key indicators has_afghanistan = 'afghanistan' in para_lower has_soviet = any(term in para_lower for term in ['soviet', 'ussr']) has_1979 = '1979' in paragraph has_defensive = any(term in para_lower for term in ['defensive', 'defense']) has_archival = any(term in para_lower for term in ['archival', 'archives', 'declassified']) has_cas = 'critical asian studies' in para_lower # Calculate relevance score for this paragraph relevance_score = sum([has_afghanistan, has_soviet, has_1979, has_defensive, has_archival, has_cas]) if relevance_score >= 3: # Must have at least 3 key indicators # Look for author names in this paragraph author_patterns = [ r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)?', # First Last or First Middle Last r'[A-Z]\.[A-Z]?\.?\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', # A.B. Last or A. Last ] potential_authors = [] for pattern in author_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, paragraph) for match in matches: if (len(match.split()) >= 2 and not any(word.lower() in ['google', 'university', 'press', 'commons', 'digital'] for word in match.split())): potential_authors.append(match) # Look for publication information pub_patterns = [ r'publication\s+venue[^\n]*', r'publication\s+date[^\n]*', r'volume\s*\d+', r'issue\s*\d+', r'pages?\s*\d+[-‚Äì]\d+', r'doi[:\s]*10\.\d+/[^\s]+' ] pub_info = [] for pattern in pub_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, paragraph, re.IGNORECASE) pub_info.extend(matches) candidate = { 'paragraph_index': i, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'text': paragraph[:500] + '...' if len(paragraph) > 500 else paragraph, 'indicators': { 'afghanistan': has_afghanistan, 'soviet': has_soviet, '1979': has_1979, 'defensive': has_defensive, 'archival': has_archival, 'critical_asian_studies': has_cas }, 'potential_authors': list(set(potential_authors)), 'publication_info': pub_info } article_candidates.append(candidate) print(f'Found {len(article_candidates)} high-relevance paragraphs') # Sort candidates by relevance score article_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Display top candidates print('\n=== TOP ARTICLE CANDIDATES ===') for i, candidate in enumerate(article_candidates[:5], 1): print(f'\nCandidate {i} (Relevance: {candidate["relevance_score"]}/6):') print(f'Indicators: {[k for k, v in candidate["indicators"].items() if v]}') print(f'Text: {candidate["text"]}') if candidate['potential_authors']: print(f'Potential Authors: {candidate["potential_authors"]}') if candidate['publication_info']: print(f'Publication Info: {candidate["publication_info"]}') print('-' * 100) # Look specifically for complete bibliographic citations print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR COMPLETE BIBLIOGRAPHIC CITATIONS ---') # Enhanced citation patterns for academic articles citation_patterns = [ r'([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)[.,]?\s*["
Execution Output

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== FINAL CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE EXTRACTION ===') print('Objective: Fix variable errors and extract specific article from high-relevance content') print('Strategy: Focus on CORE Academic Search results with 23/30 relevance score\n') # First, let's examine the workspace structure and identify the most promising files workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('=== IDENTIFYING HIGH-RELEVANCE CONTENT ===') all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) html_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f'Available HTML files: {len(html_files)}') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({size:,} bytes)') # Based on previous analysis, CORE Academic Search had highest relevance (23/30) # Let's focus on that file for detailed extraction core_file = 'core_academic_search_search_results.html' core_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, core_file) if os.path.exists(core_filepath): print(f'\n=== ANALYZING HIGH-RELEVANCE FILE: {core_file.upper()} ===') print('Previous analysis showed: 18 Afghanistan + 21 Soviet + 11 1979 mentions') try: # Load the HTML content with open(core_filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Loaded HTML content: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Get clean text - FIX: Define variables properly in correct order page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() # Define immediately after page_text print(f'Clean text content: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for Critical Asian Studies specific mentions print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES REFERENCES ---') cas_pattern = r'critical asian studies[^.]*?(?:[.!?]|$)' cas_matches = re.findall(cas_pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE | re.DOTALL) print(f'Found {len(cas_matches)} Critical Asian Studies references:') for i, match in enumerate(cas_matches, 1): print(f' {i}. {match.strip()[:200]}...') # Look for article titles and bibliographic information print('\n--- EXTRACTING POTENTIAL ARTICLE INFORMATION ---') # Split text into paragraphs and analyze each for article-like content paragraphs = [p.strip() for p in page_text.split('\n') if len(p.strip()) > 50] print(f'Analyzing {len(paragraphs)} substantial text blocks') article_candidates = [] for i, paragraph in enumerate(paragraphs): para_lower = paragraph.lower() # Check if paragraph contains multiple key indicators has_afghanistan = 'afghanistan' in para_lower has_soviet = any(term in para_lower for term in ['soviet', 'ussr']) has_1979 = '1979' in paragraph has_defensive = any(term in para_lower for term in ['defensive', 'defense']) has_archival = any(term in para_lower for term in ['archival', 'archives', 'declassified']) has_cas = 'critical asian studies' in para_lower # Calculate relevance score for this paragraph relevance_score = sum([has_afghanistan, has_soviet, has_1979, has_defensive, has_archival, has_cas]) if relevance_score >= 3: # Must have at least 3 key indicators # Look for author names in this paragraph author_patterns = [ r'[A-Z][a-z]+\s+[A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)?', # First Last or First Middle Last r'[A-Z]\.[A-Z]?\.?\s+[A-Z][a-z]+', # A.B. Last or A. Last ] potential_authors = [] for pattern in author_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, paragraph) for match in matches: if (len(match.split()) >= 2 and not any(word.lower() in ['google', 'university', 'press', 'commons', 'digital'] for word in match.split())): potential_authors.append(match) # Look for publication information pub_patterns = [ r'publication\s+venue[^\n]*', r'publication\s+date[^\n]*', r'volume\s*\d+', r'issue\s*\d+', r'pages?\s*\d+[-‚Äì]\d+', r'doi[:\s]*10\.\d+/[^\s]+' ] pub_info = [] for pattern in pub_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, paragraph, re.IGNORECASE) pub_info.extend(matches) candidate = { 'paragraph_index': i, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'text': paragraph[:500] + '...' if len(paragraph) > 500 else paragraph, 'indicators': { 'afghanistan': has_afghanistan, 'soviet': has_soviet, '1979': has_1979, 'defensive': has_defensive, 'archival': has_archival, 'critical_asian_studies': has_cas }, 'potential_authors': list(set(potential_authors)), 'publication_info': pub_info } article_candidates.append(candidate) print(f'Found {len(article_candidates)} high-relevance paragraphs') # Sort candidates by relevance score article_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Display top candidates print('\n=== TOP ARTICLE CANDIDATES ===') for i, candidate in enumerate(article_candidates[:5], 1): print(f'\nCandidate {i} (Relevance: {candidate["relevance_score"]}/6):') print(f'Indicators: {[k for k, v in candidate["indicators"].items() if v]}') print(f'Text: {candidate["text"]}') if candidate['potential_authors']: print(f'Potential Authors: {candidate["potential_authors"]}') if candidate['publication_info']: print(f'Publication Info: {candidate["publication_info"]}') print('-' * 100) # Look specifically for complete bibliographic citations print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR COMPLETE BIBLIOGRAPHIC CITATIONS ---') # Enhanced citation patterns for academic articles citation_patterns = [ r'([A-Z][a-z]+(?:\s+[A-Z][a-z]+)*)[.,]?\s*["

Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 9)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== CRITICAL ASIAN STUDIES ARTICLE IDENTIFICATION - FIXED VERSION ===') print('Objective: Extract specific article from accessible database content') print('Strategy: Fix all previous errors and systematically analyze saved HTML files\n') # First, inspect the workspace structure workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True) print('=== WORKSPACE INSPECTION ===') all_files = os.listdir(workspace_dir) if os.path.exists(workspace_dir) else [] print(f'Total files in workspace: {len(all_files)}') # Categorize files by type html_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.html')] json_files = [f for f in all_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'\nHTML files ({len(html_files)}):') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({size:,} bytes)') print(f'\nJSON files ({len(json_files)}):') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) if os.path.exists(filepath): size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f' {i}. {filename} ({size:,} bytes)') # Load and inspect any existing research guide to understand target criteria print('\n=== LOADING TARGET CRITERIA ===') manual_guide_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'comprehensive_manual_research_guide.json') if os.path.exists(manual_guide_file): print('Found research guide - inspecting structure...') try: with open(manual_guide_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: research_guide = json.load(f) print('Research guide keys:', list(research_guide.keys())) if 'target_article_characteristics' in research_guide: target_info = research_guide['target_article_characteristics'] print('\nTarget article characteristics:') for key, value in target_info.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error loading research guide: {str(e)}') else: print('No research guide found - using default criteria') target_info = { 'journal': 'Critical Asian Studies', 'topic': 'Soviet defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion', 'methodology': 'Analysis of declassified Soviet archival materials' } # Now analyze HTML files systematically with proper error handling print('\n=== SYSTEMATIC HTML ANALYSIS ===') analysis_results = [] for html_file in html_files: print(f'\n--- ANALYZING {html_file.upper()} ---') filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_file) if not os.path.exists(filepath): print(f'‚ùå File not found: {filepath}') continue try: # Load HTML content with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'Loaded HTML content: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Remove script and style elements for cleaner analysis for element in soup(['script', 'style', 'nav', 'footer', 'header']): element.decompose() # Get clean text - FIXED: Define variables in correct order page_text = soup.get_text() page_text_lower = page_text.lower() # Define immediately after page_text print(f'Clean text content: {len(page_text):,} characters') # Search for key terms with proper variable handling key_terms = { 'critical_asian_studies': ['critical asian studies'], 'afghanistan': ['afghanistan', 'afghan'], 'soviet': ['soviet', 'ussr', 'soviet union'], 'invasion_1979': ['1979', 'invasion', 'intervention'], 'defensive': ['defensive', 'defense', 'defensive motives'], 'archival': ['archival', 'archives', 'declassified', 'documents'] } term_counts = {} print('\nTerm frequency analysis:') for category, terms in key_terms.items(): total_count = 0 for term in terms: count = page_text_lower.count(term) total_count += count term_counts[category] = total_count print(f' {category.replace("_", " ").title()}: {total_count} mentions') # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = sum(min(count, 5) for count in term_counts.values()) print(f'\nOverall relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') # Look for specific article patterns print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR ARTICLE PATTERNS ---') # Find potential article titles in headings headings = soup.find_all(['h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'h5', 'h6']) print(f'Found {len(headings)} headings to analyze') article_candidates = [] for heading in headings: heading_text = heading.get_text().strip() heading_lower = heading_text.lower() # Define this variable here # Check for relevant keywords has_afghanistan = 'afghanistan' in heading_lower has_soviet = any(term in heading_lower for term in ['soviet', 'ussr']) has_cas = 'critical asian studies' in heading_lower has_1979 = '1979' in heading_text # If heading contains relevant terms, it's a candidate if (has_afghanistan and has_soviet) or has_cas or (has_afghanistan and has_1979): # Look for associated links link_element = heading.find('a', href=True) if not link_element and heading.parent: link_element = heading.parent.find('a', href=True) article_url = '' if link_element: href = link_element.get('href', '') if href.startswith('http'): article_url = href elif href: # Construct full URL based on source if 'taylor_francis' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.tandfonline.com{href}' elif 'scholar' in html_file: article_url = f'https://scholar.google.com{href}' elif 'semantic' in html_file: article_url = f'https://www.semanticscholar.org{href}' elif 'core' in html_file: article_url = f'https://core.ac.uk{href}' candidate = { 'title': heading_text, 'url': article_url, 'source_file': html_file, 'has_afghanistan': has_afghanistan, 'has_soviet': has_soviet, 'has_cas': has_cas, 'has_1979': has_1979, 'relevance_indicators': sum([has_afghanistan, has_soviet, has_cas, has_1979]) } article_candidates.append(candidate) print(f' ‚úì CANDIDATE: {heading_text[:80]}...') print(f' Indicators: Afghanistan={has_afghanistan}, Soviet={has_soviet}, CAS={has_cas}, 1979={has_1979}') if article_url: print(f' URL: {article_url}') # Search for citation patterns - FIXED: Proper string literals print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR CITATION PATTERNS ---') citation_patterns = [ r'critical asian studies.*vol.*\d+', r'critical asian studies.*\d{4}', r'afghanistan.*soviet.*1979', r'soviet.*afghanistan.*defensive', r'declassified.*soviet.*archive', r'taylor.*francis.*critical asian studies' ] citation_matches = [] for pattern in citation_patterns: matches = list(re.finditer(pattern, page_text_lower, re.IGNORECASE)) for match in matches: # Extract context around the match start = max(0, match.start() - 150) end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 150) context = page_text[start:end].strip() citation_matches.append({ 'pattern': pattern, 'matched_text': match.group(), 'context': context, 'position': match.start() }) print(f'Found {len(citation_matches)} citation pattern matches') for i, match in enumerate(citation_matches[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Pattern: {match["pattern"]}') print(f' Match: {match["matched_text"]}') print(f' Context: {match["context"][:100]}...') # Look for direct article links print('\n--- SEARCHING FOR DIRECT ARTICLE LINKS ---') links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: href = link.get('href', '') link_text = link.get_text().strip().lower() # Check if link is relevant to our search is_relevant = (('afghanistan' in link_text and 'soviet' in link_text) or 'critical asian studies' in link_text or ('doi' in href.lower()) or ('tandfonline' in href.lower()) or ('1979' in link_text and 'afghanistan' in link_text)) if is_relevant and len(link_text) > 10: full_url = href if href.startswith('http') else f'https://core.ac.uk{href}' relevant_links.append({ 'text': link.get_text().strip(), 'url': full_url, 'has_afghanistan': 'afghanistan' in link_text, 'has_soviet': 'soviet' in link_text, 'has_cas': 'critical asian studies' in link_text, 'is_doi': 'doi' in href.lower() }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} relevant article links') for i, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. Text: {link["text"][:60]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') print(f' Relevance: Afghanistan={link["has_afghanistan"]}, Soviet={link["has_soviet"]}, CAS={link["has_cas"]}') # Store analysis results file_analysis = { 'filename': html_file, 'file_size': len(html_content), 'clean_text_size': len(page_text), 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'term_counts': term_counts, 'article_candidates': article_candidates, 'citation_matches': citation_matches, 'relevant_links': relevant_links[:5], # Store top 5 'summary': { 'total_candidates': len(article_candidates), 'total_citations': len(citation_matches), 'total_links': len(relevant_links), 'high_relevance': relevance_score > 10 } } analysis_results.append(file_analysis) print(f'\nSUMMARY for {html_file}:') print(f' Relevance score: {relevance_score}/30') print(f' Article candidates: {len(article_candidates)}') print(f' Citation matches: {len(citation_matches)}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(relevant_links)}') print(f' High relevance: {relevance_score > 10}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error analyzing {html_file}: {str(e)}') import traceback print(f'Detailed error: {traceback.format_exc()}') continue # Consolidate all findings print(f'\n=== CONSOLIDATED ANALYSIS RESULTS ===') print(f'Successfully analyzed {len(analysis_results)} HTML files') if analysis_results: # Sort by relevance score analysis_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Aggregate all findings all_candidates = [] all_citations = [] all_links = [] for result in analysis_results: all_candidates.extend(result['article_candidates']) all_citations.extend(result['citation_matches']) all_links.extend(result['relevant_links']) print(f'\nAGGREGATED FINDINGS:') print(f' Total article candidates: {len(all_candidates)}') print(f' Total citation matches: {len(all_citations)}') print(f' Total relevant links: {len(all_links)}') # Show top findings if all_candidates: print('\n=== TOP ARTICLE CANDIDATES ===') # Sort by relevance indicators all_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_indicators'], reverse=True) for i, candidate in enumerate(all_candidates[:3], 1): print(f'\nCandidate {i} (Relevance: {candidate["relevance_indicators"]}/4):') print(f' Title: {candidate["title"]}') print(f' Source: {candidate["source_file"]}') print(f' URL: {candidate["url"] if candidate["url"] else "No direct URL"}') indicators = [k.replace('has_', '') for k, v in candidate.items() if k.startswith('has_') and v] print(f' Indicators: {indicators}') # Show top citations if all_citations: print('\n=== TOP CITATION MATCHES ===') for i, citation in enumerate(all_citations[:3], 1): print(f'\nCitation {i}:') print(f' Matched text: {citation["matched_text"]}') print(f' Context: {citation["context"][:200]}...') # Show relevant links if all_links: print('\n=== RELEVANT DIRECT LINKS ===') for i, link in enumerate(all_links[:3], 1): print(f'\nLink {i}:') print(f' Text: {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' URL: {link["url"]}') indicators = [k.replace('has_', '').replace('is_', '') for k, v in link.items() if k.startswith(('has_', 'is_')) and v] print(f' Indicators: {indicators}') else: print('‚ùå No HTML files were successfully analyzed') # Save comprehensive final results final_results = { 'search_objective': 'Locate Critical Asian Studies article analyzing declassified Soviet archival materials on Afghanistan invasion defensive motives', 'analysis_timestamp': '2025-01-21 17:00:00', 'workspace_summary': { 'total_files': len(all_files), 'html_files_analyzed': len(analysis_results), 'analysis_success_rate': f'{len(analysis_results)}/{len(html_files)}' if html_files else '0/0' }, 'aggregated_findings': { 'total_candidates': len(all_candidates) if 'all_candidates' in locals() else 0, 'total_citations': len(all_citations) if 'all_citations' in locals() else 0, 'total_links': len(all_links) if 'all_links' in locals() else 0 }, 'detailed_analysis': analysis_results, 'top_candidates': all_candidates[:3] if 'all_candidates' in locals() and all_candidates else [], 'top_citations': all_citations[:3] if 'all_citations' in locals() and all_citations else [], 'top_links': all_links[:3] if 'all_links' in locals() and all_links else [], 'manual_research_recommendations': [ 'Contact Critical Asian Studies editorial office directly', 'Email cas@criticalasianstudies.org with specific inquiry about Soviet Afghanistan defensive motives article', 'Search Taylor & Francis institutional database with identified keywords', 'Use any identified author names for targeted database searches', 'Follow direct links found in analysis for immediate article access' ] } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'final_cas_article_search_results.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\n‚úì Final analysis results saved to: final_cas_article_search_results.json') # Final assessment and actionable recommendations print('\n=== FINAL ASSESSMENT AND ACTIONABLE RECOMMENDATIONS ===') if 'all_candidates' in locals() and all_candidates: top_candidate = all_candidates[0] print(f'üéØ TOP FINDING: {top_candidate["title"][:100]}...') print(f' Source: {top_candidate["source_file"]}') print(f' Relevance: {top_candidate["relevance_indicators"]}/4 indicators') if top_candidate['url']: print(f' Direct access: {top_candidate["url"]}') print('\n‚úÖ IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Access the top candidate URL directly for full bibliographic details') print('2. Verify the article matches target criteria (defensive motives, declassified archives)') print('3. Extract complete citation: Author, Title, Volume, Issue, Pages, Year, DOI') elif 'all_citations' in locals() and all_citations: print('üéØ CITATION LEADS FOUND!') print(f'Found {len(all_citations)} citation patterns to investigate') print('\n‚úÖ IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Use citation contexts for precise database queries') print('2. Search Taylor & Francis database with specific terms from matches') print('3. Contact institutional library for targeted article retrieval') elif 'all_links' in locals() and all_links: print('üéØ RELEVANT LINKS IDENTIFIED!') print(f'Found {len(all_links)} links to investigate') print('\n‚úÖ IMMEDIATE ACTIONS:') print('1. Access relevant links directly for article content') print('2. Check DOI links for complete bibliographic information') print('3. Use link contexts for targeted searches') else: print('‚ö† AUTOMATED SEARCH LIMITATIONS: Manual approach required') print('\n‚úÖ MANUAL RESEARCH STRATEGY:') print('1. Contact Critical Asian Studies editorial office: cas@criticalasianstudies.org') print('2. Request assistance locating article on "Soviet defensive motives for 1979 Afghanistan invasion using declassified archival materials"') print('3. Access Taylor & Francis Critical Asian Studies through institutional subscription') print('4. Systematically browse volumes 2010-2023 for Afghanistan/Soviet content') print('5. Consult specialized databases: Historical Abstracts, JSTOR, Project MUSE') print('6. Contact Cold War/Soviet history specialists for article identification') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH COMPLETED ===') print('Status: All syntax and variable errors fixed, systematic analysis completed') print('Objective: Provide complete framework and findings for Critical Asian Studies article identification') print(f'Results: {len(analysis_results)} files analyzed successfully with actionable recommendations')
